summary.en: Pregain is the input/preamp gain set before other audio processing, used to get a clean, strong signal without clipping.
summary.zh: Pregain 指在其他音频处理之前设置的输入/前级增益，用来获得干净、足够强且不削波的信号。

definition.en: (Audio/recording) Gain applied to an audio signal before later processing stages (such as EQ, compression, or a mixer’s main fader). It helps set a healthy recording/operating level without distortion or excessive noise.
definition.zh: （音频/录音）在后续处理（如均衡、压缩或调音台主推子）之前对音频信号施加的增益。用于把电平设到合适范围，避免失真或噪声过大。

examples.en: Turn down the pregain if the meter is clipping.
examples.zh: 如果电平表显示削波（爆红），就把前级增益调低。

examples.en: Good pregain makes the vocal clearer before you add compression.
examples.zh: 合适的前级增益能让人声在加压缩之前更清晰。

definition.en: To set or adjust the preamp gain (the input gain) on audio equipment.
definition.zh: （动词）调节设备的前级增益/输入增益。

examples.en: I need to pregain this microphone a bit more.
examples.zh: 我需要把这支麦克风的前级增益再加一点。

extraExplanation: “pregain”更常见的写法是“pre-gain”或直接说“input gain / preamp gain（前级增益）”。在调音台上通常是每个通道最上方的“GAIN/TRIM”旋钮，用来先把输入信号调到合理电平。
它与“fader（推子）”不同：前级增益主要决定信号进入通道时的基础电平与噪声/失真风险；推子更多用于混音时的相对音量平衡。一个常见做法是先用前级增益让峰值不过载（不削波），再用推子做整体平衡。

summary.en: “Pregainer” is a nonstandard term, sometimes used in fitness to mean a pre-workout weight-gainer shake/supplement; other uses are rare.
summary.zh: “pregainer”不是标准词；在健身语境里有时指训练前的增重奶昔/补剂，其他用法较少见。

definition.en: (informal, fitness/bodybuilding) A supplement or meal taken before training to help increase calorie intake and promote muscle/weight gain.
definition.zh: （非正式，健身/健美）训练前吃的“增重/增肌”补剂或餐，用来提高热量摄入，帮助增肌或增重。

examples.en: He drinks a pre-gainer shake an hour before lifting to hit his calorie goals.
examples.zh: 他在力量训练前一小时喝增重奶昔，确保热量达标。

examples.en: If your stomach feels heavy, try a smaller pre-gainer snack instead of a big shake.
examples.zh: 如果你觉得胃里很撑，可以把大奶昔换成更小份的训练前增重加餐。

definition.en: (rare, informal) A person who gains weight early or easily (not a standard dictionary term).
definition.zh: （罕见，非正式）指很早就增重、或很容易长胖的人（不是标准词典词）。

examples.en: I’m a pre-gainer—I put on weight fast if I’m not careful.
examples.zh: 我属于那种很容易长胖的人——不注意就会迅速增重。

extraExplanation: “pregainer”并不是常见的标准英语单词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-gainer”，或直接说“weight gainer (shake/supplement)”（增重奶昔/补剂）。
在健身语境里，更自然的表达包括：“a weight gainer shake,” “a high-calorie shake,” “a pre-workout meal/snack.”
如果你指的是孕期相关（pregnancy）增重，通常会说“pregnancy weight gain”或“gained weight during pregnancy”，而不会用“pregainer”。

summary.en: Pregalvanize means to zinc-coat metal in advance (before fabrication/installation).
summary.zh: Pregalvanize 指在加工/安装前先给金属镀锌（预镀锌）。

definition.en: to galvanize (coat steel/iron with zinc) before it is made into a final product or installed; to use pre-galvanized metal
definition.zh: （金属加工）在制成最终产品或安装之前先进行镀锌处理；使用预镀锌金属

examples.en: The manufacturer pregalvanizes the steel coil before cutting it into panels.
examples.zh: 厂家先把钢卷预镀锌，再切割成面板。

examples.en: We chose pregalvanized studs to reduce rust in the warehouse.
examples.zh: 我们选用预镀锌龙骨来减少仓库里的生锈问题。

definition.en: (figurative, less common) to energize or motivate someone in advance
definition.zh: （引申义，较少见）提前激励、预先鼓动某人

examples.en: The coach tried to pregalvanize the team with a short speech before the big week.
examples.zh: 教练在关键的一周到来前，用一段简短的讲话提前鼓舞全队。

extraExplanation: “pregalvanize”常见于工业/建材语境，更常写作“pre-galvanize / pregalvanized”。意思是材料在成型、冲压或安装前就先镀锌（zinc coating）。这不同于“hot-dip galvanize after fabrication”（成品后再热浸镀锌）。预镀锌适合大量生产，但切口或焊点可能需要额外防锈处理。

summary.en: Pregalvanized means zinc-coated metal (especially steel) that was galvanized before being fabricated into its final form.
summary.zh: Pregalvanized 指金属（尤指钢材）在加工成最终形态之前就已完成镀锌的“预镀锌”材料。

definition.en: (of steel or metal) coated with a protective layer of zinc before it is made into the final product, to reduce rust and corrosion.
definition.zh: （钢或金属）在制成最终成品之前就先镀锌（预镀锌），以减少生锈和腐蚀。

examples.en: The company uses pregalvanized steel sheets to make HVAC ducts.
examples.zh: 这家公司用预镀锌钢板来制作暖通空调（HVAC）风管。

examples.en: Pregalvanized studs are common for interior wall framing.
examples.zh: 预镀锌龙骨常用于室内墙体骨架。

extraExplanation: “Pregalvanized”常见于建材/金属加工领域，尤其是钢板、钢卷、龙骨（studs）、风管等。它强调“先镀锌、后加工”。
与“hot-dip galvanized（热浸镀锌）”常被对比：热浸镀锌通常是在零件成型后整体浸入锌液，涂层往往更厚、更耐户外环境；预镀锌多用于室内或相对温和环境，加工切边处可能更容易暴露钢材，需要根据规范/环境选材。
写法上也常见作“pre-galvanized”。在采购或图纸里，它通常是材料规格描述，不是日常英语高频词。

summary.en: “Pregalvanizing” means galvanizing metal in advance (or metal that has already been galvanized before fabrication) to improve corrosion resistance.
summary.zh: “pregalvanizing”指对金属进行预先镀锌（或指已在加工前完成镀锌的金属），以增强防锈耐腐蚀能力。

definition.en: (of metal, especially steel) galvanized before it is cut, formed, or assembled into a final product.
definition.zh: （多指金属，尤指钢材）在切割、成型或组装成最终产品之前就已完成镀锌处理的。

examples.en: The project specified pregalvanizing for the structural steel to improve corrosion resistance.
examples.zh: 该项目要求结构钢采用预镀锌处理，以提高耐腐蚀性。

examples.en: Pregalvanizing can protect the inside surfaces of steel tubing before it is fabricated.
examples.zh: 预镀锌可以在钢管加工前保护其内表面。

definition.en: The process or practice of galvanizing metal in advance of further manufacturing or fabrication.
definition.zh: 预镀锌：在进一步制造或加工之前先对金属进行镀锌的工艺或做法。

examples.en: Pregalvanizing is common for sheet steel used in outdoor equipment.
examples.zh: 用于户外设备的钢板常采用预镀锌工艺。

definition.en: Present participle of “pregalvanize”: to galvanize metal before later fabrication or assembly.
definition.zh: “pregalvanize”的现在分词：在后续加工或装配之前先对金属进行镀锌。

examples.en: They are pregalvanizing the coil stock before it is stamped into parts.
examples.zh: 他们在将卷材冲压成零件之前先对其进行预镀锌。

extraExplanation: “galvanize”在金属加工里通常指“镀锌”（常见为热浸镀锌或电镀锌），用锌层来防锈。前面加上“pre-”表示“预先做”。因此“pregalvanized steel”常见于建材、管材、板材等行业用语。
需要注意：预镀锌与“加工完成后再整体镀锌”（如整件热浸镀锌）不同。预镀锌在切割/焊接后，切口或焊缝位置可能需要额外防腐处理（如补漆、补锌）。

summary.en: Pregame means “before the event”—either the official sports pregame period/show, or an informal hangout (often with drinks) before going out; it can be a noun, verb, or adjective.
summary.zh: Pregame 表示“活动/比赛开始之前”：既可指体育里的赛前环节/节目，也可指出门前的非正式小聚（常伴随饮酒）；可作名词、动词或形容词。

definition.en: An informal gathering or activities (often with food or drinks) before going to an event, especially a party, concert, or game.
definition.zh: （非正式）在去参加活动（尤其是派对、演唱会或比赛）之前的聚会或活动，常常会吃点东西或喝点酒。

examples.en: We’re doing a small pregame at my place before the concert.
examples.zh: 演唱会前我们会先在我家小聚一下。

examples.en: Let’s pregame with snacks so we don’t buy expensive food at the stadium.
examples.zh: 我们先吃点零食当作赛前小吃吧，这样就不用在球场买贵的食物了。

definition.en: To spend time (often drinking or hanging out) before going to an event.
definition.zh: （非正式）在去参加活动之前先聚一下（常指先喝点酒或先社交热身）。

examples.en: Do you want to pregame before the party?
examples.zh: 去派对之前你想先预热聚一下吗？

examples.en: They pregamed at a friend’s apartment and then took a ride-share downtown.
examples.zh: 他们先在朋友公寓预热聚了聚，然后叫车去市中心。

definition.en: Happening before the start of a sports game (used in sports coverage).
definition.zh: （体育用语）比赛开始前的；赛前的。

examples.en: Catch the pregame show at 6 p.m.
examples.zh: 晚上六点看赛前节目。

examples.en: The coach gave a pregame speech to motivate the team.
examples.zh: 教练在赛前发表讲话鼓舞球队。

extraExplanation: “pregame”来自“pre-（之前）+ game（比赛）”，最早常见于体育语境（pregame show/analysis）。后来在口语里扩展为“去活动前先聚/先喝点”，尤其在大学或年轻人社交场景中更常见。
注意语域：表示“赛前节目/赛前分析”比较中性；表示“去派对前先喝酒”在正式场合或职场不太适合。
近义说法：pre-party（派对前聚）、pre-drinks（先喝几杯，英式更常见）、warm up（热身/预热，含义更广）。

summary.en: Preganglionic means “before a ganglion,” especially describing autonomic nerve fibers that go from the CNS to a ganglion.
summary.zh: preganglionic 意为“神经节之前的”，尤指自主神经系统中从中枢神经系统通向神经节的神经纤维。

definition.en: (of a nerve fiber or neuron) located before a ganglion; in the autonomic nervous system, running from the central nervous system to an autonomic ganglion.
definition.zh: （神经纤维或神经元）位于神经节之前的；在自主神经系统中，指从中枢神经系统通向自主神经节的。

examples.en: Preganglionic neurons carry signals from the spinal cord to autonomic ganglia.
examples.zh: 节前神经元把信号从脊髓传到自主神经节。

examples.en: The doctor explained that preganglionic fibers synapse in a ganglion before reaching the target organ.
examples.zh: 医生解释说，节前纤维会先在神经节处形成突触，再到达靶器官。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，“ganglion”指“神经节”，“-ic”构成形容词。合起来就是“神经节之前的”。
常见对比词：postganglionic（节后），指从神经节到效应器官（如心脏、腺体、平滑肌）的神经纤维。

summary.en: Pregastrular means “before gastrulation,” referring to very early embryo stages prior to germ-layer formation.
summary.zh: pregastrular 指“原肠胚形成之前的”，用于描述胚胎在主要胚层建立前的早期阶段。

definition.en: (Biology, embryology) Happening before gastrulation—the stage when an early embryo reorganizes to form the main germ layers.
definition.zh: （生物学/胚胎学）原肠胚形成（原肠运动）之前的；指胚胎在开始形成主要胚层之前的阶段或过程。

examples.en: Researchers compared gene activity in pre-gastrular embryos and later-stage embryos.
examples.zh: 研究人员比较了原肠胚形成前胚胎与更晚期胚胎的基因活性。

examples.en: In many species, the embryo is a simple cell mass in the pre-gastrular period.
examples.zh: 在许多物种中，胚胎在原肠胚形成前阶段只是一个相对简单的细胞群。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“……之前”。“gastrular”来自“gastrula（原肠胚）”，与“gastrulation（原肠胚形成/原肠运动）”相关。
原肠胚形成通常是胚胎发育的关键转折点：细胞开始迁移与重排，建立外胚层/中胚层/内胚层等主要胚层，因此“pregastrular”常用于强调“在这些重大形态变化发生之前”的阶段。
在学术写作中也常见拼写形式“pre-gastrular”（带连字符）或“pre-gastrulation（原肠胚形成之前）”。

summary.en: “Pregather” means to gather or assemble in advance.
summary.zh: “pregather”表示“提前收集或集合”。

definition.en: to gather or collect something in advance; to assemble beforehand
definition.zh: 预先收集；事先聚集（在事情发生前先把东西或人凑齐）

examples.en: We pregathered the documents so the meeting could start on time.
examples.zh: 我们预先把文件收集好，这样会议就能准时开始。

examples.en: The volunteers pregather supplies before the storm season begins.
examples.zh: 志愿者会在暴风季开始前预先集结物资。

definition.en: to come together beforehand; to assemble in advance
definition.zh: 预先聚集；提前集合

examples.en: Fans pregathered outside the venue hours before the concert.
examples.zh: 演唱会开始前好几个小时，粉丝们就提前聚集在场馆外。

examples.en: The group pregathered at the café before heading to the museum.
examples.zh: 大家先在咖啡馆提前集合，然后再去博物馆。

extraExplanation: “pregather”并不是非常常见的日常用词，更常见的表达是 “gather in advance / collect beforehand / assemble ahead of time”。它由前缀 “pre-”（在……之前）+ “gather”（聚集/收集）构成，意思直观。

summary.en: “Pregathering” (more commonly “pre-gathering”) means something that happens before the main gathering, or a small get-together held beforehand.
summary.zh: “pregathering”（更常写作“pre-gathering”）指在主要聚会/活动之前发生的事，或指正式聚会前的一个小型先行聚会。

definition.en: Happening before the main gathering or event (often used as an adjective before a noun).
definition.zh: 发生在主要聚会或活动之前的（常作形容词，放在名词前）。

examples.en: We had a pre-gathering dinner before the conference welcome party.
examples.zh: 我们在会议欢迎派对前先吃了一顿“预聚会”晚餐。

examples.en: The team held a pre-gathering check-in to review the schedule.
examples.zh: 团队在正式集合前开了个简短的预先确认会来过一遍行程。

definition.en: A small meeting or activity that happens before the main gathering; a warm-up get-together.
definition.zh: 正式聚会前的小型聚会或活动；“热身”的先行聚会。

examples.en: There’s a pre-gathering at 6 p.m., and the main event starts at 7.
examples.zh: 6点有个预聚会，7点正式活动开始。

examples.en: The pre-gathering helped newcomers feel more comfortable.
examples.zh: 这个预聚会让新来的人更放松、更好融入。

extraExplanation: “pregathering”在实际英文中更常写作带连字符的“pre-gathering”。不加连字符也能看懂，但正式写作或清晰表达时建议用“pre-gathering”。
它不是非常常见的固定词条，更常见的替代表达有“pre-event meetup / pre-meeting / kickoff meeting / get-together beforehand”等。

summary.en: “pregeminum” is not a recognized standard English word; it’s probably a misspelling or a rare technical/Latin form.
summary.zh: “pregeminum”不是标准英语词；很可能是拼写错误或罕见的专业/拉丁词形。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; it is likely a misspelling or a rare Latin/technical form used in specific fields (e.g., anatomy or biology). In general English dictionaries, it is not a recognized entry.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；更可能是拼写错误，或某些专业领域（如解剖学、生物学）里极少见的拉丁/术语形式。一般英语词典中通常查不到该词条。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “pregeminum” in an English dictionary—could it be a typo?
examples.zh: 我在英语词典里找不到“pregeminum”——会不会是拼写错误？

examples.en: If you saw “pregeminum” in a medical text, sharing the sentence would help identify the intended term.
examples.zh: 如果你是在医学文本里看到“pregeminum”，把原句发出来会更容易判断它到底想表达哪个词。

extraExplanation:
这个词很可能是你从某段专业文本中抄到的拉丁化词形，或是把相近词写错了。常见的“看起来像”的英语词包括：
- pregame / pregaming（赛前活动；口语常用）
- pergamum / Pergamon（帕加马：古城名；也见于历史/考古语境）
- perineum（会阴：解剖学名词）
如果你把它出现的原句（前后各一句）或学科背景（医学/生物/历史等）发来，我可以更准确地帮你定位它可能对应的正确词。

summary.en: “Pregenerate” means to create or compute something ahead of time, usually to save time later.
summary.zh: pregenerate 指“预先生成/提前算出”，多用于技术语境，为了之后更快或更方便。

definition.en: to generate or create something in advance, before it is actually needed (often by a computer program)
definition.zh: 预先生成；提前生成（通常指程序在真正需要之前先把内容算好/做出来）

examples.en: The app pregenerates thumbnails so pages load faster.
examples.zh: 这个应用会预先生成缩略图，让页面加载更快。

examples.en: We pregenerated the report templates before the meeting.
examples.zh: 我们在开会前就把报告模板提前生成好了。

definition.en: to produce a set of possible results ahead of time so they can be chosen or used later
definition.zh: 预先生成一组可能的结果，便于之后选择或使用

examples.en: The game pregenerates several character names for new players.
examples.zh: 这款游戏会为新玩家预先生成几个角色名字。

examples.en: To avoid delays, the system pregenerated backup codes.
examples.zh: 为了避免延迟，系统预先生成了备用验证码。

extraExplanation: “pregenerate”由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ generate 组成，常见于编程/数据处理/游戏开发语境。通常表示为了性能或便利性，先把计算结果、资源文件或内容（如缩略图、缓存、地图、随机数据）提前生成。
写作中更常见的替代表达有 “generate in advance / precompute / pre-render”（分别偏通用、偏计算、偏图形渲染）。在正式文体里，“pregenerate”有时显得偏技术或口语化。

summary.en: Pregenerated means created in advance, especially for faster use later (often in computing).
summary.zh: Pregenerated 指“预先生成的”，常用于计算机语境，表示为以后更快使用而提前产出的内容。

definition.en: Made or created in advance (before it is needed), often by a computer program or process.
definition.zh: 预先生成的；提前制作好的（通常指在需要之前由程序或流程先生成）。

examples.en: The app loads faster because it uses pregenerated thumbnails.
examples.zh: 这个应用加载更快，因为它使用了预先生成的缩略图。

examples.en: We used a pregenerated report template to save time.
examples.zh: 我们用预先生成的报告模板来节省时间。

definition.en: Produced beforehand as an output (especially data, images, code, or content) rather than generated on demand.
definition.zh: 事先产出的（尤指数据、图像、代码或内容），而不是按需实时生成的。

examples.en: The game includes pregenerated maps instead of building them every time you play.
examples.zh: 这款游戏包含预先生成的地图，而不是每次游玩都重新生成。

examples.en: Pregenerated sample data helps testers reproduce bugs consistently.
examples.zh: 预先生成的样本数据能帮助测试人员稳定复现漏洞。

extraExplanation: “pregenerated”常见于计算机领域（如网站、游戏、数据处理）。和“precomputed（预计算的）”“pre-rendered（预渲染的）”含义接近：都是把原本可以实时做的工作提前做完，以换取更快的加载/运行速度，但代价可能是占用更多存储空间、更新不够灵活。
词形：pre-（提前）+ generated（生成的）。写作中更常见的变体还有“pre-generated”（带连字符），两者通常都可接受，具体看团队风格指南。

summary.en: Pregenerating means generating something in advance, often to save time later.
summary.zh: pregenerating 指“提前生成/预先制作”，常为之后节省时间或提升性能。

definition.en: creating or producing something in advance (before it is actually needed), especially in computing or media production
definition.zh: 预先生成；提前制作（在真正需要之前先产出内容，尤用于计算机/媒体制作）

examples.en: To speed up the app, we’re pregenerating thumbnails for every image.
examples.zh: 为了加快应用速度，我们在为每张图片预先生成缩略图。

examples.en: The team is pregenerating reports overnight so users can download them instantly in the morning.
examples.zh: 团队会在夜间预先生成报表，这样用户早上就能立刻下载。

extraExplanation: “pregenerating”是动词“pregenerate”的现在分词形式（也可作形容词用），常见于技术语境，强调“先算好/先做出”，以减少实时计算或等待时间。
相关搭配：pregenerate data（预生成数据）、pregenerate assets（预生成资源）、pregenerate cache（预生成缓存）。

summary.en: Pregeneration most often means generating something in advance (especially in computing); more rarely, it can mean an earlier generation of people.
summary.zh: pregeneration 通常指“预先生成”（尤其在计算机领域）；较少情况下也可指“前一代人”。

definition.en: The act or process of generating something in advance (before it is needed), especially in computing (e.g., pre-generated pages, files, or data).
definition.zh: 预先生成；在需要之前先把某物生成出来（常见于计算机领域，如预生成页面、文件或数据）。

examples.en: The website uses pregeneration to build the pages ahead of time, so they load faster.
examples.zh: 这个网站使用预先生成，把页面提前构建好，所以加载更快。

examples.en: Pregeneration of reports saves time during busy hours.
examples.zh: 预先生成报表能在高峰时段节省时间。

definition.en: A generation that comes before another; an earlier generation (rare).
definition.zh: 前一代；更早的一代人（较少见）。

examples.en: The author contrasts the values of the pregeneration with those of today's youth.
examples.zh: 作者把前一代的价值观与当代年轻人的价值观作对比。

extraExplanation: “pregeneration”不是非常常用的日常词，更常见的表达是“pre-generation”（带连字符）或直接说“pre-generate / pre-generated”。在技术文档里，尤其是网站开发（如静态站点生成）场景中更容易遇到。
词源上可拆为前缀“pre-”（在……之前）+ “generation”（生成/一代）。如果你想表达“提前做完以便后面更快”，也常用“precompute（预计算）”“prebuild（预构建）”“cache（缓存）”等更具体的词。

summary.en: A rare, nonstandard noun meaning “generosity shown in advance.”
summary.zh: 一个罕见、非标准名词，表示“提前展现的慷慨”。

definition.en: (Rare/nonce) generosity shown in advance; a tendency to be generous beforehand (not a standard dictionary word).
definition.zh: （罕见/临时造词）事先表现出的慷慨；提前展现的大方倾向（并非常见词典词条）。

examples.en: The donor’s pregenerosity—offering help before anyone asked—set a warm tone for the project.
examples.zh: 捐助者的“提前慷慨”——在没人开口前就主动提供帮助——为这个项目定下了温暖的基调。

examples.en: In her essay, she praised her mentor’s pregenerosity: encouragement given before failure happened.
examples.zh: 在文章中，她称赞导师的“提前慷慨”：在失败发生之前就先给出的鼓励。

extraExplanation: 这个词由前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）+ generosity（“慷慨”）组合而来，但在日常英语中非常少见。写作中如果想表达同样意思，更自然的说法包括: proactive generosity（主动的慷慨）、unexpected generosity（出乎意料的慷慨）、generosity in advance（提前的慷慨）、being generous before being asked（在被请求前就很慷慨）。
如果你是在某本书、论文或文章里看到 pregenerosity，它可能是作者的创意用词（nonce word），用来强调“还没发生/还没被要求就先给出”的感觉。

summary.en: “Pregenerous” is a rare, nonstandard word meaning “generous in advance.”
summary.zh: “Pregenerous”是罕见且不太标准的词，意思是“预先慷慨的”。

definition.en: (Rare, nonstandard) generous in advance; giving more than is necessary before it is asked for or needed.
definition.zh: （罕见、非标准用法）预先慷慨的；在对方尚未提出或尚未需要之前就给得很多（甚至超出必要）。

examples.en: He was almost pregenerous, paying for everyone’s meal before they could offer to split the bill.
examples.zh: 他几乎称得上“预先慷慨”，在大家还没来得及提出AA之前就把所有人的饭钱都付了。

examples.en: The manager’s pregenerous promises created expectations the team couldn’t meet later.
examples.zh: 经理那些“预先慷慨”的承诺抬高了期待，后来团队反而难以兑现。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里非常少见，很多词典不收录，通常是把前缀 pre-（“在……之前”）加到 generous（“慷慨的”）上，临时造出来的表达。写作或正式场合更常用：generous in advance / overly generous / premature generosity（过早的慷慨）。如果你是想表达“过于慷慨”，更地道的是 overgenerous。

summary.en: “Pregenerously” is a nonstandard adverb meaning “generously in advance,” and it’s usually better to rephrase it in more natural English.
summary.zh: “pregenerously”不是标准词，想表达的是“提前慷慨地”。更推荐用更自然的英文改写。

definition.en: (Nonstandard) Generously in advance; done ahead of time in a generous way. Often written with a hyphen as “pre-generously,” but most writers would rephrase it (e.g., “generously beforehand”).
definition.zh: （非标准用法）提前慷慨地（给予/做某事）；表示“事先就很大方地……”。常见写法会加连字符作“pre-generously”，但更自然的英文通常会改写为“generously beforehand / in advance”。

examples.en: They pre-generously funded the project so the team could start immediately.
examples.zh: 他们提前慷慨资助了这个项目，让团队可以立刻开始。

examples.en: The sponsor, acting pre-generously, covered the first month’s costs in advance.
examples.zh: 赞助方事先很大方地把第一个月的费用提前付了。

extraExplanation:
“pregenerously”在常见英语词典里通常找不到，更多像是临时造词或拼写/断词问题。更地道的表达包括：
- generously in advance（提前慷慨地）
- generously beforehand（事先很大方地）
- preemptively donated（预先捐赠了）
写作中建议用这些自然搭配，读者更容易理解。

summary.en: A rare technical adjective meaning “in front of the chin (genial region).”
summary.zh: 一个很少见的专业形容词，表示“位于下巴（颏部）之前的”。

definition.en: (Anatomy, zoology) Located in front of the chin (the “genial” region).
definition.zh: （解剖学／动物学）位于下巴（颏部，genial）之前的；下巴前方的。

examples.en: In some anatomical descriptions, the pregenial area refers to tissue just in front of the chin.
examples.zh: 在一些解剖学描述中，pregenial area 指的是下巴正前方的组织区域。

examples.en: The diagram labels a small pregenial region beneath the lower lip.
examples.zh: 图示在下唇下方标出了一个小的下巴前区（pregenial region）。

extraExplanation: 这个词在日常英语里非常罕见，多见于专业文献（解剖学、动物学或昆虫学的结构标注）。
genial 在这里不是“友好的、和蔼的”（那个 genial），而是来自拉丁语词根，意思与“颏/下巴（chin）”有关，所以 pregenial 就是“在下巴前面的”。
容易与 pregenital（生殖器前的）混淆；两者拼写接近，但含义和使用领域不同。

summary.en: A Latin taxonomy term meaning “bent just before a knee-like joint or node.”
summary.zh: 拉丁分类学用语，意为“在膝状关节/节之前就开始弯折的”。

definition.en: (Latin; used in scientific names) describing something that is bent or angled slightly *before* a knee-like joint or node (i.e., ‘pre‑geniculate’ in shape).
definition.zh: （拉丁文；用于生物学学名）形容某结构在“膝状弯曲/节状弯曲”之前就已略微弯折或成角（即“预膝状弯曲”的形态）。

examples.en: In some plant descriptions, *pregeniculatum* refers to a stem or stalk that starts to bend just before a node.
examples.zh: 在一些植物形态描述中，*pregeniculatum* 可指茎或花梗在节之前就开始弯折。

examples.en: You may see *pregeniculatum* as a species epithet, matching the gender/ending of the genus name.
examples.zh: 你可能会在物种种加词中见到 *pregeniculatum*，其词尾会配合属名的语法性别/形式。

extraExplanation: 这是拉丁形容词形式，常见于分类学（植物、真菌等）的学名或拉丁式形态描述中，并不是日常英语词汇。
词源可拆为 *pre-*（在……之前）+ *geniculatus*（“膝状弯曲的”，来自 *geniculum* “小膝/膝状关节”）。在分类学里，词尾 *-um* 往往是为了与属名的语法形式一致（如中性单数）。

summary.en: A rare botanical term for the segment just before a knee-like bend (geniculum) in a plant structure.
summary.zh: 一个少见的植物学术语，指植物结构中位于“膝状弯曲处”（geniculum）之前的那一段。

definition.en: (Botany) A part or segment just before a geniculum (a knee-like bend) in a plant structure, especially in grasses/grass-like plants.
definition.zh: （植物学）在植物结构中、尤其是禾本科植物里，位于“膝状弯曲处”（geniculum）之前的那一段/部位。

examples.en: Under the microscope, the pregeniculum appears as a short, straight section before the knee-like bend.
examples.zh: 在显微镜下，pregeniculum 看起来是在膝状弯曲之前的一小段直线部分。

examples.en: In some grasses, the awn shows a clear geniculum, and the pregeniculum can be measured for identification.
examples.zh: 在一些禾本科植物中，芒针有明显的膝状弯曲，而其前膝段（pregeniculum）可用于测量和鉴定。

extraExplanation: 这个词很少见，多用于形态学/分类学描述。构词来自拉丁语：pre-（在……之前）+ geniculum（小“膝盖”，指“膝状弯曲”）。在禾本科植物的芒（awn）或细长结构上，研究者有时会用“geniculum（膝）”来描述弯折点，用“pregeniculum”来指弯折点之前的那一段。

summary.en: “Pregenital” means “before genital maturity,” and it is often used in Freudian theory for stages before the genital stage (oral/anal).
summary.zh: “Pregenital”指“生殖器官成熟之前的”，也常用于弗洛伊德理论，表示生殖期之前的阶段（如口欲期/肛欲期）。

definition.en: Occurring or developing before the genital organs are mature or fully formed (especially in early childhood development).
definition.zh: （尤指早期发育中）发生在生殖器官成熟或完全形成之前的；生殖器前期的。

examples.en: In some animals, certain traits appear in a pregenital stage and change later.
examples.zh: 在一些动物中，某些特征会在生殖器尚未发育成熟的前期出现，之后再改变。

examples.en: The textbook describes pregenital development as the period before reproductive maturity.
examples.zh: 教材把生殖器前期的发育描述为生殖成熟之前的一段时期。

definition.en: In psychoanalysis (Freudian theory), relating to stages before the genital stage—commonly the oral and anal stages.
definition.zh: （精神分析/弗洛伊德理论）指“生殖期”之前的阶段，通常包括口欲期与肛欲期。

examples.en: Freud used the term pregenital to refer to the oral and anal phases of development.
examples.zh: 弗洛伊德用“pregenital”来指代发育中的口欲期和肛欲期。

examples.en: Some writers discuss pregenital conflicts when explaining early childhood behavior.
examples.zh: 有些作者在解释幼儿行为时会谈到“生殖期之前的冲突”。

extraExplanation: “pregenital”常见于心理学/精神分析语境（尤其是弗洛伊德的“性心理发展阶段”），属于特定理论用语，并不等同于日常英语里对“性”的讨论。阅读相关文本时，更多是在谈儿童发展阶段与心理动力，而不是成人性行为。
词形结构：pre-（在……之前）+ genital（生殖的）。
使用场合较学术，日常对话里很少用；如果只是想表达“青春期前的/未到性成熟的”，更常见的词是 “prepubertal” 或 “before puberty”。

summary.en: Pregeological describes ideas or periods before geology became a developed science (or before geological history is used as a framework).
summary.zh: pregeological 指地质学发展成系统科学之前的（或在采用地质历史框架之前的）观点、时期或解释。

definition.en: Existing or happening before geology (the science) developed, or before geological history/records are considered.
definition.zh: 地质学（这门学科）形成之前的；或指在讨论地质历史/地质记录之前的。

examples.en: In the 1700s, many people had a pregeological view of Earth’s history, based mainly on myths and religious texts.
examples.zh: 在18世纪，许多人对地球历史的理解还处于“前地质学”的阶段，主要依据神话和宗教文本。

examples.en: The author contrasts pregeological explanations of mountains with modern plate tectonics.
examples.zh: 作者把“前地质学”对山脉的解释与现代板块构造理论作了对比。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见，常见于学术写作或科普史（如“地质学史”）里，用来强调：在地质学成为一门系统科学之前，人们对地球与地貌的解释方式（例如把化石当作“怪石”、用神话解释山脉形成）。
有时它也可更宽泛地表示“早于地质记录/地质时代的”（though this is rarer），写作时最好用上下文说明是“学科出现之前”还是“地质历史之前”。

summary.en: “Preggers” is an informal slang word meaning “pregnant.”
summary.zh: “preggers”是表示“怀孕”的非正式俚语。

definition.en: (informal, slang) Pregnant; expecting a baby.
definition.zh: （非正式俚语）怀孕的；有身孕的。

examples.en: She announced she was preggers, and everyone cheered.
examples.zh: 她宣布自己怀孕了，大家都欢呼起来。

examples.en: I can’t drink tonight—I’m preggers.
examples.zh: 我今晚不能喝酒——我怀孕了。

examples.en: The movie uses “preggers” as a casual, joking way to say “pregnant.”
examples.zh: 这部电影里用“preggers”来轻松、带点玩笑地表达“怀孕”。

extraExplanation: “preggers”是英语口语里的俚语，语气比较随意，有时带点搞笑/卖萌的感觉。和正式的“pregnant”相比，它不适合用于医疗、职场公文或严肃场合。
在一些语境里，这个词可能让人觉得不够尊重或不够成熟；如果不确定对方是否介意，用更中性的“pregnant”或“expecting (a baby)”更安全。

summary.en: “Preghiera” (Italian) most commonly means “prayer,” and can also mean a formal “plea/request.”
summary.zh: “preghiera”（意大利语）最常指“祈祷/祷告”，也可指较正式的“恳求/请求”。

definition.en: a prayer; words spoken or thought to worship, thank, or ask a god for help
definition.zh: 祈祷；向神明表达崇拜、感谢或请求帮助的祷告话语

examples.en: She said a short prayer before bed.
examples.zh: 她睡前做了一个简短的祈祷。

examples.en: In the church, people listened in silence during the prayer.
examples.zh: 在教堂里，人们在祷告时安静聆听。

definition.en: a plea or earnest request (often formal or literary)
definition.zh: 恳求；郑重的请求（常见于正式或文学语境）

examples.en: His last request was a plea for peace.
examples.zh: 他最后的请求是一声对和平的恳求。

examples.en: The letter ended with a humble plea for forgiveness.
examples.zh: 信末以谦卑的恳求请求原谅作结。

extraExplanation: “preghiera”是意大利语名词，最常指宗教意义上的“祷告/祈祷”。在更正式或带文学色彩的语境中，也可表示“恳求、请求”。
词形上常见搭配：fare una preghiera（做一次祈祷）、una preghiera per la pace（为和平的祈祷）。

summary.en: “Pregirlhood” means the time before girlhood; it’s an uncommon, often literary way to refer to very early childhood.
summary.zh: “pregirlhood”指女孩期之前的阶段；不常见，常用于文学/叙事语境来指更早的童年。

definition.en: The period or stage before someone is considered a girl (i.e., before girlhood); early childhood, especially in reference to a female child.
definition.zh: 女孩期（girlhood）之前的阶段；（多指女性）更早的童年时期。

examples.en: The memoir describes her life from pregirlhood to adulthood.
examples.zh: 这本回忆录描写了她从“女孩期之前”到成年的生活。

examples.en: Photos from her pregirlhood show her as a toddler with her family.
examples.zh: 她“女孩期之前”的照片里，她还是个和家人在一起的幼儿。

definition.en: Relating to the time before girlhood; occurring in early childhood (before the typical “girlhood” years).
definition.zh: 与女孩期之前有关的；发生在更早童年阶段的。

examples.en: She kept a few pregirlhood drawings in a folder.
examples.zh: 她把几张“女孩期之前”的涂鸦画收在一个文件夹里。

examples.en: The novel briefly mentions a pregirlhood memory.
examples.zh: 小说简短提到了一段“女孩期之前”的记忆。

extraExplanation: 这个词不太常见，更多是作者为了叙述人生阶段而“临时造词”（pre- + girlhood）。在正式写作中，常见替代表达有：early childhood（幼年/早期童年）、toddler years（学步期）、before girlhood（在女孩期之前）。
使用时常带一点文学/叙事色彩，用来强调“还没进入典型的女孩期（school-age girlhood）之前”的那段时间。若要更自然，可以直接写：when she was very young / in early childhood。

summary.en: “Preglacial” means ‘before the glaciers/ice age period.’
summary.zh: “preglacial”表示“冰川（冰期）之前的”。

definition.en: Existing or occurring before a period when glaciers covered an area (before a glaciation).
definition.zh: 冰川期之前的；发生在冰川覆盖某地之前的（冰期前的）。

examples.en: Scientists studied preglacial soils to understand what the landscape was like before the ice arrived.
examples.zh: 科学家研究冰期前的土壤，以了解冰到来之前的地貌。

examples.en: The river followed a preglacial valley that was later reshaped by glaciers.
examples.zh: 这条河沿着一条冰期前的山谷流动，而该山谷后来被冰川改造。

extraExplanation: 词源构成：前缀 pre- 表示“在……之前”，glacial 表示“冰川的”。因此 preglacial 直译为“冰川之前的”。
常见搭配（地质/地理语境）：preglacial landscape（冰期前地貌）、preglacial river/valley（冰期前河流/山谷）、preglacial deposits/soils（冰期前沉积物/土壤）。
使用场景提示：这是偏学术的词，常见于地质学、古气候学、地貌学的文章或博物馆解说中。

summary.en: Pregladden means to make someone feel happy beforehand.
summary.zh: pregladden 指“在事情发生前先使人感到高兴/欣喜”。

definition.en: to make someone feel happy in advance; to gladden beforehand
definition.zh: （在事情发生前）预先使人高兴；先使人欣喜

examples.en: The thought of seeing her family again pregladdened her during the long trip.
examples.zh: 想到能再次见到家人，让她在漫长的旅途中提前感到欣喜。

examples.en: Good news can pregladden a worried heart before the problem is fully solved.
examples.zh: 好消息能在问题尚未完全解决前，就先让忧心的人心里一亮。

extraExplanation: “pregladden”较少见，带有文学/古风色彩，多用于书面语。由前缀“pre-（预先）”+ “gladden（使高兴）”构成，意思就是“提前让人感到高兴”。日常英语里更常用“make (someone) happy/excited in advance”或“delight”。

summary.en: An archaic poetic noun meaning “great joy” or “intense gladness.”
summary.zh: 一个古语/诗歌用名词，意思是“极大的喜悦、强烈的欢欣”。

definition.en: (Archaic/poetic) Great joy; intense gladness.
definition.zh: （古语/诗歌用语）极大的喜悦；欢欣若狂。

examples.en: The news filled her heart with pregladness.
examples.zh: 这个消息让她心中充满极大的喜悦。

examples.en: They welcomed the travelers with pregladness and song.
examples.zh: 他们以极大的欢欣和歌声迎接旅人。

extraExplanation: “pregladness”属于较少见的古英语/诗歌式用词。这里的前缀“pre-”并不是现代英语里常见的“预先”，而更接近古用法中的强调作用，表示“非常、极其”。
在阅读古典文学或宗教/颂歌式文本时更可能见到此词。现代英语更常用“great joy / deep gladness / delight / happiness”。

summary.en: Preglenoid means “in front of the glenoid (shoulder socket).”
summary.zh: preglenoid 意为“位于肩关节盂（关节盂）前方的”。

definition.en: (Anatomy) Located in front of the glenoid (the shallow socket of the shoulder blade where the upper arm bone fits).
definition.zh: （解剖）位于盂（肩胛骨上与肱骨相接的浅窝/关节窝）之前的；盂前的。

examples.en: The MRI report noted swelling in the preglenoid soft tissues.
examples.zh: 核磁共振报告指出盂前软组织有肿胀。

examples.en: The surgeon inspected the preglenoid area before repairing the labrum.
examples.zh: 外科医生在修复关节盂唇前检查了盂前区域。

extraExplanation: “preglenoid”由前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ glenoid（盂/关节盂）构成，常见于影像学报告、手术记录或解剖描述，尤其与肩关节相关。
“glenoid”通常指肩胛骨的关节盂（glenoid fossa/cavity）。因此“preglenoid”不是一个日常用词，而是用来精确定位病变或结构的位置（相对关节盂的前方）。

summary.en: An anatomical adjective meaning “in front of the shoulder’s glenoid cavity.”
summary.zh: 解剖学形容词，表示“位于肩胛骨盂腔（肩关节盂）前方的”。

definition.en: Located in front of the glenoid cavity (the shoulder socket) of the scapula.
definition.zh: 位于肩胛骨盂腔（肩关节盂/肩臼）的前方；“盂前的/盂前区的”。

examples.en: The report notes tenderness in the preglenoidal region of the shoulder.
examples.zh: 报告指出肩部盂前区域有压痛。

examples.en: Preglenoidal soft tissues can be stressed in some shoulder injuries.
examples.zh: 某些肩部损伤会使盂前软组织受到牵拉或应力。

extraExplanation: 该词由前缀 pre-（在……之前/前方）+ glenoid（盂/关节盂，常指肩胛骨的盂腔）构成，多见于解剖学、影像学或临床描述中，用来精确定位肩关节附近结构。
“glenoid cavity”指肩胛骨上的关节盂（肩关节的“窝/插座”），与肱骨头构成肩关节；preglenoidal 表示在这个“窝”的前侧。

summary.en: Preglobulin is a rarely used lab term for a serum-protein fraction that appears before globulins in electrophoresis.
summary.zh: Preglobulin 是一个较少见的实验室术语，指在血清蛋白电泳中出现在球蛋白之前的蛋白组分。

definition.en: (Biochemistry) A minor fraction of blood-serum proteins that migrates ahead of the globulins in electrophoresis (often used in older or specialized lab descriptions).
definition.zh: （生物化学）血清蛋白中的一种较小“组分”，在电泳分离时迁移位置位于球蛋白（globulins）之前（多见于较旧或特定的实验室表述）。

examples.en: The report mentioned an unusual rise in the preglobulin fraction on serum electrophoresis.
examples.zh: 报告提到血清电泳中“preglobulin（前球蛋白）”组分异常升高。

examples.en: In older textbooks, preglobulin is described as a small band that appears before the globulin bands.
examples.zh: 在较老的教材中，preglobulin 被描述为出现在球蛋白条带之前的一条小条带。

extraExplanation: 这是一个相对少见、偏实验室语境的词，常与“血清蛋白电泳（serum protein electrophoresis）”一起出现。不同实验体系/年代的命名不完全一致，有时会把某些“跑在球蛋白前面”的蛋白或脂蛋白区带用类似称呼概括，因此阅读文献时要结合具体检测方法和报告中的分区名称来理解。

summary.en: Pregnability means the ability to become pregnant (or, in biology, to be fertilized).
summary.zh: Pregnability 指“可受孕性/受孕能力”（或生物学中“可受精/可受粉的能力”）。

definition.en: the ability of a woman or female animal to become pregnant; fertility (ability to conceive)
definition.zh: （女性或雌性动物）可受孕性；受孕能力；生育力（能怀孕/受精并成功着床的能力）

examples.en: Age, hormones, and overall health can affect pregnability.
examples.zh: 年龄、激素水平和整体健康状况都会影响可受孕性。

examples.en: The doctor explained that low pregnability does not always mean someone can never get pregnant.
examples.zh: 医生解释说，可受孕性较低并不一定意味着永远不能怀孕。

definition.en: in biology or botany, the capacity to be impregnated or fertilized (to receive and develop new life)
definition.zh: （生物学/植物学）可被受精或受粉并发育的能力；可受精性/可受粉性

examples.en: In some plants, environmental conditions can change the timing of flowers and their pregnability.
examples.zh: 在某些植物中，环境条件会改变开花时间以及花的可受粉性。

extraExplanation: “pregnability”是比较少见、偏学术的名词，常见于生殖医学或生物学语境。日常英语里更常用“fertility”（生育力）或“ability to conceive”（受孕能力）。
词形来自“pregnant（怀孕的）+ -ability（……的能力）”。注意不要与“pregnancy（怀孕、妊娠）”混淆：pregnancy强调“已经怀孕的状态”，pregnability强调“能否怀上”。

summary.en: “Pregnable” means “able to be attacked or captured,” an archaic/literary opposite of “impregnable.”
summary.zh: “pregnable”意为“可被攻击或攻下的”，属古语/文学用法，常与“impregnable（坚不可摧的）”相对。

definition.en: Able to be captured, attacked, or overcome; not well protected (archaic or literary).
definition.zh: （古语/文学用语）可被攻下的；易受攻击的；防守不严的。

examples.en: The fort looked strong, but it was pregnable from the sea.
examples.zh: 那座堡垒看起来坚固，但从海上进攻却是可攻下的。

examples.en: Even the most confident argument can be pregnable if its evidence is weak.
examples.zh: 即使最自信的论点，如果证据薄弱，也可能不堪一击。

extraExplanation: “pregnable”常见于较老的英语文本，意思接近“可被攻破的”，与更常用的“vulnerable / assailable”相近。它常与“impregnable（坚不可摧的）”成对出现；impregnable 是否定前缀 im- + pregnable。
词源上与拉丁语 *praehendere / prendere*（抓住、夺取）有关，因此带有“能被夺取/占领”的含义。
文学语境中常用来描述城堡、要塞或抽象事物（如论点、地位）的“可攻破性”；例如莎士比亚等早期作品中会出现类似用法。

summary.en: “Pregnance” is a rare noun meaning “pregnancy,” and in literary use it can mean “richness or fullness of meaning.”
summary.zh: “Pregnance”是个很少见的名词，可指“怀孕/妊娠”，在文学语境中也可指“意味深长、含义饱满”。

definition.en: (Of a woman or female animal) the state of carrying a developing baby/young inside the body; being pregnant.
definition.zh: （女性或雌性动物）怀孕；妊娠状态。

examples.en: She learned about her pregnance during a routine checkup.
examples.zh: 她在例行检查中得知自己怀孕了。

examples.en: In older medical writing, “pregnance” sometimes appears where modern English uses “pregnancy.”
examples.zh: 在较早的医学写作中，“pregnance”有时会出现在现代英语用“pregnancy”的地方。

definition.en: (Rare, literary) fullness of meaning; the quality of being rich and suggestive in significance.
definition.zh: （罕见，文学用法）意味深长；含义饱满、富有暗示性。

examples.en: The poem’s strength lies in the pregnance of its images.
examples.zh: 这首诗的力量在于其意象的意味深长。

examples.en: Her short reply had a quiet pregnance that made everyone pause.
examples.zh: 她简短的回答带着一种沉静的意味，让所有人都停顿了一下。

extraExplanation: “pregnance”在现代英语里非常少见。日常与正式写作中几乎一律用“pregnancy”（怀孕/妊娠）。
该词与形容词“pregnant”同源。除“怀孕”外，“pregnant with meaning”（意味深长的/富有启示的）是更常见的表达，比名词“pregnance”更自然。
如果你是在文学评论或老文本里看到“pregnance”，通常是在强调“含义的浓度/暗示性”，而不是生理意义。

summary.en: “Pregnancies” is the plural form of “pregnancy,” meaning one or more periods of being pregnant.
summary.zh: “pregnancies”是“pregnancy”的复数，表示一个或多个怀孕/妊娠阶段。

definition.en: The state of being pregnant; the time during which a baby develops inside a woman’s uterus (womb).
definition.zh: 怀孕；妊娠期（胎儿在子宫内发育的时期）。

examples.en: Her first pregnancy was healthy and uncomplicated.
examples.zh: 她第一次怀孕很健康，没有并发症。

examples.en: During pregnancy, many people need more rest and regular checkups.
examples.zh: 在怀孕期间，很多人需要更多休息和定期产检。

definition.en: More than one pregnancy (plural of “pregnancy”).
definition.zh: 多次怀孕；多段妊娠（“pregnancy”的复数）。

examples.en: The clinic supports women through their pregnancies.
examples.zh: 这家诊所为女性在怀孕期间提供支持。

examples.en: She has had two pregnancies.
examples.zh: 她经历过两次怀孕。

extraExplanation: “Pregnancies”是名词复数，指多个“怀孕/妊娠”。如果你要说“她现在怀孕了”，英语更常说：She is pregnant.（而不是 *She is pregnancy*）。
与“pregnancy”相关的常见搭配：pregnancy test（验孕）、pregnancy symptoms（妊娠反应/症状）、pregnancy leave / maternity leave（产假）。日常表达中也常用更中性的说法，如 “expecting a baby”（在期待宝宝出生）。

summary.en: Pregnancy is the time when a baby develops inside the uterus; it also means the condition of being pregnant.
summary.zh: Pregnancy 指“怀孕/妊娠”，也指从受孕到分娩前胎儿在子宫内发育的整个孕期。

definition.en: The state of being pregnant; the period when a baby develops inside a person’s uterus (womb), usually about 40 weeks from the last menstrual period.
definition.zh: 怀孕；妊娠期：胎儿在子宫内发育的阶段，通常从末次月经算起约40周。

examples.en: She found out about her pregnancy in the first trimester.
examples.zh: 她在孕早期发现自己怀孕了。

examples.en: Regular prenatal care can support a healthier pregnancy.
examples.zh: 规律的产前检查有助于更健康的孕期。

examples.en: He supported his partner throughout the pregnancy.
examples.zh: 他在整个孕期都支持伴侣。

extraExplanation: 用词提醒：英语里常说 “during pregnancy（在孕期）”“pregnancy test（验孕/早孕试纸）”“prenatal care（产前护理/产检）”。谈到当事人时，很多英语语境会用更尊重与包容的表达，比如 “pregnant person（怀孕的人）” 来涵盖不同性别身份。
常见搭配：planned/unplanned pregnancy（计划内/意外怀孕）、high-risk pregnancy（高危妊娠）、full-term pregnancy（足月妊娠）、early/late pregnancy（孕早期/孕晚期）、pregnancy symptoms（妊娠反应/症状）。
文学与文化语感：在文学或报道中，pregnancy 常被用来象征“孕育、生成、即将到来的变化（a time of transformation）”，既指生理过程，也可带有情感与人生转折的意味。

summary.en: “Pregnant” means expecting a baby; it can also figuratively mean “full of tension/meaning/possibility.”
summary.zh: “Pregnant”表示“怀孕的”；也可比喻表示“充满紧张/意义/可能性”。

definition.en: (Spelling note) The correct word is “pregnant,” meaning a woman or female animal has a baby developing inside her body.
definition.zh: （拼写提示）正确拼写是“pregnant”，意思是（女人或雌性动物）怀孕的，体内正在孕育宝宝。

examples.en: She is pregnant with her first child.
examples.zh: 她怀着第一个孩子。

examples.en: The cat was pregnant and needed a quiet place.
examples.zh: 那只猫怀孕了，需要一个安静的地方。

definition.en: (Figurative) Full of meaning, importance, or possibility; likely to produce a result.
definition.zh: （比喻）充满意义/重要性/可能性；很可能带来结果的。

examples.en: The silence was pregnant with tension.
examples.zh: 那种沉默充满了紧张气氛。

examples.en: It was a moment pregnant with possibility.
examples.zh: 那是一个充满可能性的时刻。

extraExplanation: “pregnant”是形容词，常见搭配：be pregnant（怀孕）；be pregnant with…（怀着……，也可用于比喻）。
日常英语里更口语的说法有：She’s expecting. / She’s having a baby.（更委婉、不直接说“pregnant”）。

summary.en: Pregnant mainly means having a baby developing inside the body; in formal writing it can also mean “full of meaning/possibility.”
summary.zh: pregnant 主要指“怀孕的”；在较正式/文学语境中也可指“充满含义/酝酿可能性的”。

definition.en: If a person or female animal is pregnant, they have a baby (or young) developing inside their body.
definition.zh: （人或雌性动物）怀孕的；妊娠的；体内正孕育着胎儿（或幼崽）的。

examples.en: She is three months pregnant.
examples.zh: 她怀孕三个月了。

examples.en: The vet confirmed the dog is pregnant.
examples.zh: 兽医确认这只狗怀孕了。

examples.en: It’s important to eat well when you’re pregnant.
examples.zh: 怀孕时好好吃饭很重要。

definition.en: Pregnant (with) can mean “full of,” “carrying,” or “likely to produce” an important idea, event, or result (often used in writing).
definition.zh: （常用于书面语）pregnant (with) 可表示“充满……的 / 蕴含……的 / 酝酿着……结果的”。

examples.en: The pause was pregnant with meaning.
examples.zh: 那一阵沉默意味深长。

examples.en: The air felt pregnant with possibility.
examples.zh: 空气里仿佛酝酿着无限可能。

extraExplanation: 在英语里，谈到“pregnant”时通常可以说：be pregnant / get pregnant（怀孕）/ become pregnant（变得怀孕）。更口语、也更含蓄的说法有：be expecting（在等宝宝，常指“怀孕”）。
表达周数/月份常见结构：X weeks/months pregnant（怀孕X周/个月）。
书面义“pregnant with…”常见于文学或严肃写作，强调“含义深、暗示多、即将发生某事”的氛围。

summary.en: “Pregnantly” usually means “in a way that is full of meaning,” not “while pregnant.”
summary.zh: “pregnantly”通常指“意味深长地”，而不是“怀孕时/怀着身孕”。

definition.en: In a way that is full of meaning or significance; expressively and powerfully (often about a statement, image, or silence).
definition.zh: 意味深长地；富有含义（常形容一句话、一个画面或沉默表达得有力而耐人寻味）。

examples.en: She paused pregnantly before answering.
examples.zh: 她意味深长地停顿了一下才回答。

examples.en: The photograph pregnantly suggests loneliness.
examples.zh: 这张照片意味深长地暗示了孤独。

definition.en: In a way that relates to pregnancy; while being pregnant (rare in modern use).
definition.zh: 怀孕地；在怀孕期间（现代英语中较少这样用）。

examples.en: In older writing, you may see phrasing like “she walked pregnantly through the garden.”
examples.zh: 在较旧的作品里，你可能会看到类似“她怀着身孕穿过花园”这样的表达。

extraExplanation: “pregnantly”最常见的意思不是“怀孕地”，而是“意味深长地”。它来自形容词“pregnant”的比喻用法：像“充满生命”一样，指“充满意义/暗示”。
现代英语里，如果要表达“怀孕时/怀着身孕”，更自然的说法通常是“while pregnant”“during pregnancy”或“when she was pregnant”。
搭配提示：常与 pause / silence / look / moment / phrase 等名词或动词搭配，如 “a pregnantly long silence”（意味深长的长久沉默）。

summary.en: “Pregnantness” is a rare noun meaning “pregnancy,” and sometimes (figuratively) “being full of meaning.”
summary.zh: “pregnantness”是罕见名词，主要指“怀孕/妊娠”，也可比喻“意味深长、充满含义”。

definition.en: (Rare) the state or condition of being pregnant; pregnancy.
definition.zh: （罕见用法）怀孕的状态；妊娠。

examples.en: The doctor confirmed her pregnancy early in the first trimester.
examples.zh: 医生在第一孕期早期确认了她怀孕。

examples.en: In most writing, people say “pregnancy,” not “pregnantness.”
examples.zh: 在大多数写作中，人们说“pregnancy（怀孕）”，而不是“pregnantness”。

definition.en: (Figurative, rare) a quality of being “full of meaning,” significance, or possibilities.
definition.zh: （比喻，罕见）“意味深长 / 充满含义或可能性”的特质。

examples.en: The silence in the room had a strange richness, as if it were full of meaning.
examples.zh: 房间里的沉默带着一种奇异的厚重感，仿佛充满了含义。

examples.en: Writers more commonly say “a pregnant pause” than “pregnantness.”
examples.zh: 作家更常说“a pregnant pause（意味深长的停顿）”，而不是“pregnantness”。

extraExplanation: “pregnantness”不是常用词，更自然、正式的表达通常是“pregnancy”。如果你在论文、新闻或医疗语境中写作，建议用“pregnancy”。
英语里“pregnant”还有比喻用法，表示“充满…的、意味深长的”（如“a pregnant pause”）。这种比喻意义在文学写作中更常见，但名词形式仍多用“significance / richness / implication”等，而不是“pregnantness”。
涉及怀孕相关表达时，不同文化与个人经历差异很大；在沟通中用更中性、尊重的词（如“pregnancy”或直接用对方偏好的说法）通常更合适。

summary.en: Pregnenolone is a natural steroid hormone that serves as a building block for other hormones; it is also sold as a dietary supplement.
summary.zh: 孕烯醇酮是一种人体自然产生的类固醇激素，是合成多种激素的“前体”；它也常作为膳食补充剂出售。

definition.en: a naturally occurring steroid hormone made in the body (mainly from cholesterol) that helps the body produce other hormones, such as progesterone, cortisol, estrogen, and testosterone
definition.zh: 一种人体内自然产生的类固醇激素（主要由胆固醇合成），可作为“前体”帮助身体合成其他激素，如黄体酮、皮质醇、雌激素和睾酮

examples.en: Pregnenolone is often described as a “precursor hormone” because the body can convert it into other hormones.
examples.zh: 孕烯醇酮常被称为“前体激素”，因为身体可以把它转化成其他激素。

examples.en: Your doctor may order hormone tests before discussing pregnenolone or related treatments.
examples.zh: 医生可能会先安排激素检查，再讨论孕烯醇酮或相关治疗。

definition.en: a dietary supplement that contains pregnenolone, marketed for purposes such as memory, mood, or energy (effects and safety can vary)
definition.zh: 含有孕烯醇酮的膳食补充剂，常被宣传用于记忆、情绪或精力等（效果与安全性因人而异）

examples.en: Some people take pregnenolone supplements, but it’s important to check interactions with other medications.
examples.zh: 有些人会服用孕烯醇酮补充剂，但要注意它与其他药物的相互作用。

examples.en: In the U.S., pregnenolone is sold as a supplement, not as an FDA-approved medicine for most uses.
examples.zh: 在美国，孕烯醇酮多以补充剂形式出售，而非针对多数用途获得 FDA 批准的药物。

extraExplanation: “Pregnenolone”常见于医学与保健品语境。它属于“类固醇激素”家族，和性激素、压力激素的合成路径有关，但并不等同于雌激素/睾酮本身。
作为补充剂时，不同人反应差异较大；可能出现失眠、烦躁、头痛、痤疮等不适。若有激素相关疾病（如乳腺/前列腺问题）、正在备孕/怀孕、或正在用激素类药物，建议先咨询医生。

summary.en: Pregolden means “before becoming golden,” and less commonly “before a golden age.”
summary.zh: pregolden 表示“变成金黄色之前的”，较少见时也可指“黄金时代之前的”。

definition.en: Occurring before something becomes golden in color (for example, before hair, leaves, or food turns golden).
definition.zh: 在某物变成金黄色之前发生的（如头发、树叶或食物尚未变成金黄色时）。

examples.en: Bake the cookies for a few more minutes—their pregolden color means they’re not ready yet.
examples.zh: 再烤几分钟——它们现在还没到金黄色，说明还没熟。

examples.en: The photographer preferred the pregolden light just before sunset.
examples.zh: 摄影师更喜欢日落前那种尚未呈金色的光线。

definition.en: (Less common) Existing or imagined as coming before a “golden age,” especially in writing about history, culture, or mythology.
definition.zh: （较少见）指在“黄金时代”之前的（常用于历史、文化或神话语境的想象或描述）。

examples.en: The novel is set in a pregolden era, before the kingdom’s prosperity.
examples.zh: 小说背景设定在王国繁荣之前的“黄金时代之前”。

examples.en: Some legends describe a pregolden world filled with struggle and change.
examples.zh: 一些传说描写了一个充满挣扎与变动的“黄金时代之前”的世界。

extraExplanation: “pregolden”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的写法可能是“pre-golden”（加连字符），表示“在……变金之前”。它由前缀“pre-（在……之前）+ golden（金色的/黄金时代的）”构成。
如果你想表达“日落前的金色时刻”，更地道的说法通常是“the golden hour”（黄金时刻）或“just before the golden hour”。

summary.en: “Pregolfing” is an informal word meaning “before golfing/before a round of golf.”
summary.zh: “pregolfing”是非正式说法，意思是“打高尔夫之前/一轮球开始之前”。

definition.en: (informal) Doing something before going golfing, or happening before a round of golf (often used for warm-ups, preparation, or pre-game socializing).
definition.zh: （非正式）在去打高尔夫之前做的事；或指高尔夫开打前发生的活动（常指热身、准备或开打前的社交活动）。

examples.en: We met for a quick coffee pregolfing.
examples.zh: 我们打球前（pregolfing）先快速喝了杯咖啡。

examples.en: He likes a few stretches pregolfing to loosen up his back.
examples.zh: 他喜欢在打球前（pregolfing）做些拉伸，让背部放松。

examples.en: The clubhouse gets busy with pregolfing chatter in the morning.
examples.zh: 早上俱乐部里打球前（pregolfing）的闲聊会让这里很热闹。

extraExplanation: “pregolfing”不是非常标准的词，更常见的表达是“before golfing / before a round of golf / pre-golf”。在口语或社交媒体里，人们会把“pre-（在……之前）”加到活动名词或动名词前，临时造词，表示“……之前的（时间/活动）”。
如果你想写得更正式，可以用：“before the round,” “pre-round warm-up,” “prior to tee time（开球时间之前）”。

summary.en: Pregracile means “before the gracile (slender) stage,” used mostly in scientific contexts.
summary.zh: pregracile 指“在纤细型（gracile）之前的阶段/特征”，主要见于科学语境。

definition.en: (Biology/anthropology) Describing an earlier evolutionary or developmental stage that comes before a gracile (slender, lightly built) form.
definition.zh: （生物学/人类学）指在演化或发育过程中，处于“纤细型（gracile）”之前的较早阶段。

examples.en: Some researchers describe certain fossil features as pregracile, suggesting they appeared before a fully gracile body form evolved.
examples.zh: 一些研究者把某些化石特征描述为 pregracile，表示这些特征出现在完全纤细体型演化之前。

examples.en: The paper compares robust traits with pregracile traits in early hominin specimens.
examples.zh: 这篇论文比较了早期人族标本中的粗壮特征与 pregracile（纤细化之前的）特征。

definition.en: More generally: not yet gracile; before becoming slender or delicate in shape.
definition.zh: 更一般地说：尚未变得纤细；处于变得纤细、轻巧之前的状态。

examples.en: In the early phase, the structure looks pregracile—thicker and less streamlined than in later stages.
examples.zh: 在早期阶段，这个结构看起来是 pregracile 的——比后期更厚实、不那么流线。

extraExplanation: pregracile = pre-（“在……之前”）+ gracile（“纤细的、轻巧的”）。这个词非常少见，多用于学术写作，尤其是人类演化、动物形态学等领域，用来表达“在纤细型出现之前的阶段/特征”。
在非专业英语里，人们更常用 earlier, less slender, not yet slender, thicker 等说法来表达类似意思。

summary.en: “Pregracious” is not standard English; it’s likely a misspelling of “precocious” or “gracious.”
summary.zh: “pregracious”不是标准英语词；多半是把“precocious”或“gracious”拼错了。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; usually a misspelling or a nonstandard coinage. People often mean “precocious” (showing advanced ability too early) or “gracious” (polite and kind).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；通常是拼写错误或临时造词。人们常常其实想写“precocious”（过早显得成熟/早慧）或“gracious”（有礼、亲切、宽厚）。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “pregracious” in a dictionary—did you mean “precocious” or “gracious”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“pregracious”——你是不是想写“precocious”或“gracious”？

examples.en: The child is very precocious for her age.
examples.zh: 这个孩子对她的年龄来说非常早慧。

examples.en: Thank you for being so gracious about the mistake.
examples.zh: 谢谢你对这个错误如此宽容有礼。

extraExplanation: “pre-”通常是前缀，表示“在……之前”（如 prewar 战前的）。但“pregracious”并不是常见、规范的组合形式，所以在正式写作中建议改用你真正想表达的词。
如果你想表达“特别有礼貌/特别宽厚”，可以用 very gracious / extremely gracious；如果想表达“孩子早熟早慧”，用 precocious。

summary.en: Pregrade means to grade something in advance (unofficially) or to describe something that happens before final grading.
summary.zh: pregrade 指在最终评分前进行预评分/先行打分，或指“评分之前”的相关步骤与材料。

definition.en: to give a preliminary or unofficial grade/score to (work) before final grading is complete
definition.zh: （在最终评分前）对（作业/试卷等）进行预评分、先行打分

examples.en: I pregraded the quizzes so I could see which topics the class struggled with.
examples.zh: 我先把小测预评分了一下，这样就能看出全班在哪些知识点上比较吃力。

examples.en: Some teachers pregrade essays with a checklist before assigning a final score.
examples.zh: 有些老师会先用核对清单对作文做预评分，然后再给出最终分数。

definition.en: happening or existing before grading is done; used to describe materials or steps in the grading process
definition.zh: 发生在评分之前的；用于描述评分流程中的材料或步骤

examples.en: Students received pregrade feedback to improve their drafts.
examples.zh: 学生收到了评分前的反馈，用来改进草稿。

examples.en: The rubric was shared in a pregrade meeting.
examples.zh: 评分标准在一次评分前会议上被分享。

extraExplanation: “pregrade”在实际写作中不算常见，更常见的表达是“pre-grading”（评分前的阶段）或“preliminary grading”（初步评分）。是否加连字符取决于风格：作定语时常写作“pre-grading feedback / pre-grading step”。
在教育语境里，它通常指“为了诊断学习问题而先行快速打分/标记”，并不等同于正式的最终成绩。

summary.en: “Pregraded” means already graded in advance (often by a teacher or an automated system).
summary.zh: “pregraded”表示“已提前批改/预先评分的”（常由老师或自动系统完成）。

definition.en: (Of an assignment, test, or dataset) already graded or marked before you receive it.
definition.zh: （作业、考试或数据集）预先批改过的；已经评分/打分的。

examples.en: The instructor uploaded pregraded quizzes so students could review the answers right away.
examples.zh: 老师上传了预先批改好的小测验，让学生可以立刻复习答案。

examples.en: I was surprised to see a pregraded worksheet in the study packet.
examples.zh: 我在学习资料包里看到一份已经批改过的练习单，挺意外的。

definition.en: Past tense/past participle of “pregrade”: to grade or mark something in advance.
definition.zh: “pregrade”的过去式/过去分词：预先批改；提前评分。

examples.en: The system pregraded the multiple-choice section automatically.
examples.zh: 系统自动预先批改了选择题部分。

examples.en: These were pregraded using an answer key.
examples.zh: 这些是用答案钥匙（标准答案）提前批改的。

extraExplanation: “pregraded”常见于教育与在线学习平台语境：例如系统会先用标准答案自动评分（多选/判断），老师再人工复核主观题。
有时也用于编程/数据处理场景：比如把带有评分或标签（labels）的样本提前处理好，用于训练或校验。

summary.en: Pregrading means doing an early assessment or preliminary grading—either of student work (before final scoring) or of land (before final leveling).
summary.zh: Pregrading 指在最终结果之前先做初步评估或预处理：可以是对作业的预评分，也可以是施工中的预整平。

definition.en: (Education) The act of assessing or grouping students’ work before final grading, often to plan feedback, set grade levels, or place students into appropriate levels.
definition.zh: （教育）在最终评分前先进行评估或分组的过程，常用于安排反馈、设定评分档位或进行分班/分层。

examples.en: The teacher did pregrading to sort essays into “needs revision” and “ready to score.”
examples.zh: 老师先做预评分，把作文分成“需要修改”和“可以评分”两类。

examples.en: Pregrading helped the team agree on what an A-level answer looked like.
examples.zh: 预评分帮助团队先统一“A档答案”的标准。

definition.en: (Construction/landscaping) The act of shaping or leveling the ground before the final grading is done.
definition.zh: （施工/园林）在最终整平（grading）前对地面进行初步整形或找平的过程。

examples.en: Pregrading the site reduced standing water after heavy rain.
examples.zh: 对工地做预整平后，大雨过后积水减少了。

examples.en: They finished pregrading before laying the drainage pipes.
examples.zh: 他们在铺设排水管前完成了预整形。

definition.en: The present participle of “pregrade”: to assess or grade something in advance, or to do preliminary grading of land.
definition.zh: “pregrade”的现在分词：指提前评估/预先评分，或对土地进行初步整平。

examples.en: I’m pregrading the quizzes so I can return them quickly tomorrow.
examples.zh: 我正在预先批改测验，这样明天就能很快发回。

examples.en: Crews are pregrading the roadbed this week.
examples.zh: 施工队这周在对路基做预整形。

extraExplanation: “pregrading”不是最常见的日常词，更常见的表达包括：教育场景用“preliminary grading / initial grading / pre-assessment”，施工场景用“rough grading / preliminary grading”。不过在行业内部文件或流程说明中，“pregrading”也会出现。
写作提示：如果你的读者不在该领域，建议用更直观的说法（如“grading in advance / preliminary grading”）以避免误解。

summary.en: Pregraduation means the time or events before graduation.
summary.zh: pregraduation 指“毕业前”的时期或相关活动。

definition.en: The period or activities happening before someone graduates (often from college or high school).
definition.zh: 毕业前的时期；毕业前进行的活动（常指大学或高中）。

examples.en: She attended a pregraduation workshop on job interviews.
examples.zh: 她参加了一个毕业前的求职面试工作坊。

examples.en: During the pregraduation months, students are busy finishing projects and applying for jobs.
examples.zh: 在毕业前的几个月里，学生忙着完成项目并申请工作。

extraExplanation: “pregraduation”在日常英语里不算常见，更常见的写法是连字符形式“pre-graduation”，或直接说“before graduation / prior to graduation”。
常见搭配：pre-graduation ceremony（毕业前仪式）、pre-graduation requirements（毕业前要求）、pre-graduation counseling（毕业前辅导）。

summary.en: “Pregranite” is a rare geology term meaning “older than (formed before) granite in a local area.”
summary.zh: “pregranite”是一个较少见的地质学用语，表示“在某地花岗岩形成/侵入之前就已形成的（比花岗岩更早的）”。

definition.en: (Geology, uncommon) Existing or formed before a granite body formed or intruded into surrounding rock; earlier than granite in a local rock sequence.
definition.zh: （地质学，较少见）指在某一地区的花岗岩体形成或侵入之前就已存在或形成的；在当地岩石序列中早于花岗岩的。

examples.en: The metamorphic belt includes pregranite schists that were later cut by granite veins.
examples.zh: 这条变质带包含一些前花岗岩时期的片岩，之后被花岗岩脉切穿。

examples.en: They sampled pregranite rocks to compare them with the younger granite intrusion.
examples.zh: 他们采集了前花岗岩期的岩石，用来与较年轻的花岗岩侵入体进行对比。

extraExplanation: “pregranite”不是日常英语词汇，主要见于地质/岩石学写作中，用来做相对年代的描述（“早于花岗岩侵入/形成”）。更常见的写法是“pregranitic”（前花岗岩期的）。
很多学习者看到“pregranite”其实是想写“pregnant”（怀孕的）。如果你想查的是“pregnant”，告诉我，我可以按常用义详细解释。

summary.en: A geology term meaning “older than the granite; formed before granite formed or intruded.”
summary.zh: 地质术语，指“比花岗岩更早；在花岗岩形成或侵入之前形成的”。

definition.en: (Geology) Existing or formed before granite (or a granite intrusion) formed in an area; older than the granite.
definition.zh: （地质）在某地区花岗岩（或花岗岩侵入体）形成之前就已存在或形成的；比花岗岩更早的。

examples.en: The pregranitic rocks were later cut by granite dikes.
examples.zh: 这些前花岗岩岩石后来被花岗岩岩脉切穿。

examples.en: Fossils are rare in the pregranitic basement because it is very old and metamorphosed.
examples.zh: 由于非常古老且经历变质作用，前花岗岩基底中很少见到化石。

extraExplanation: “pre-”表示“在……之前”，而“granitic”表示“花岗岩的/与花岗岩有关的”。因此 pregranitic 多用于地质报告或论文，描述“花岗岩侵入或形成之前的围岩/基底”。
常见搭配包括：pregranitic rocks（前花岗岩岩石）、pregranitic basement（前花岗岩基底）、pregranitic strata（前花岗岩地层）。在野外或薄片描述中，它通常用于建立相对年代关系：先有 pregranitic 岩石，后有花岗岩侵入。

summary.en: Pregratification means enjoying a reward before you’ve earned it—an uncommon term for the opposite of delayed gratification.
summary.zh: Pregratification 指在还没“赚到/完成”之前就先享受奖励或满足；是个不常见、近似“延迟满足”的反义概念。

definition.en: (Rare, informal) Getting a reward or pleasure before you have earned it; the opposite of “delayed gratification.”
definition.zh: （罕见/非正式）在付出努力或完成任务之前就先获得奖励或满足感；与“延迟满足”相对。

examples.en: Buying a new phone before finishing the project felt like pregratification.
examples.zh: 项目还没做完就买了新手机，感觉像是在“预先满足”。

examples.en: Some apps encourage pregratification by giving instant rewards for small actions.
examples.zh: 一些应用会用小动作的即时奖励来鼓励“预先满足”。

extraExplanation: “pregratification”不是常见标准词汇，在主流词典中较少收录；更常见的表达是“instant gratification（即时满足）”或“immediate gratification（立即满足）”。
构词上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ gratification（满足/享受）。在写作或正式场合，建议用“instant/immediate gratification”来避免读者觉得生僻或不自然。

summary.en: “Pregratified” is a rare, nonstandard word meaning “already pleased or satisfied in advance.”
summary.zh: “pregratified”是个罕见且非标准的词，大意是“提前就感到满足/高兴”。

definition.en: (Rare/Nonstandard) Feeling pleased or satisfied in advance; already gratified before something actually happens.
definition.zh: （罕见/非标准用法）提前感到满足或高兴；事情发生前就已经被“满足/取悦”。

examples.en: She sounded pregratified, as if the award were already hers.
examples.zh: 她听起来像是提前就满足了，好像奖项已经是她的了。

examples.en: The marketing promised a pregratified experience—everything felt decided before we arrived.
examples.zh: 营销宣传承诺一种“提前满足”的体验——我们还没到，一切就像已经被安排好了。

extraExplanation: “pregratified”不是常见标准词，写作中很少见；更常见的表达是“already satisfied / prematurely satisfied / self-satisfied / smug”。
如果你是在把两个部分拼在一起表达含义，更自然的写法通常是加连字符：pre-gratified（提前被满足/取悦）。
词源上可以理解为前缀 pre-（在……之前）+ gratified（感到满足/高兴）。但在正式写作里，建议改用更常见的同义表达以避免读者困惑。

summary.en: Pregratify means to gratify someone in advance, often by giving a favor beforehand to gain support.
summary.zh: pregratify 指“提前取悦/讨好（某人）”，常带有先给好处以换取支持的含义。

definition.en: (Rare/old-fashioned) To please or satisfy someone in advance, often by giving a favor, gift, or payment beforehand to win support.
definition.zh: （罕见/旧式）预先讨好或满足某人，常指提前给予好处、礼物或报酬以争取支持。

examples.en: The candidate tried to pregratify influential donors with early access to his plans.
examples.zh: 这位候选人试图用提前透露计划的方式来预先讨好有影响力的捐助者。

examples.en: In the novel, the merchant pregratified the official with a “small token” before asking for help.
examples.zh: 小说里，商人在开口求助前先用“一点心意”来预先讨好官员。

extraExplanation: 这个词由 pre-（“在……之前”）+ gratify（“使满意/取悦”）组成，语感上接近“先给甜头”。在现代英语里非常少见，写作中更常用 bribe（贿赂）、curry favor（讨好）、sweeten the deal（先加点好处）等更自然的表达。
由于它带有“用提前利益换取好感”的暗示，语境可能涉及不正当的讨好或变相行贿；正式写作中使用时要注意语气和道德评价。

summary.en: Pregratifying is a rare, nonstandard adjective meaning “gratifying in advance” or “pleasing beforehand.”
summary.zh: pregratifying 是一个罕见且不太规范的形容词，大意是“提前令人满足/愉悦的”。

definition.en: (Nonstandard/rare) Giving satisfaction or pleasure in advance; gratifying beforehand.
definition.zh: （非标准/罕见用法）预先带来满足或愉悦的；提前让人觉得很满足的。

examples.en: Getting praise before I even started felt pregratifying, but it also made me nervous.
examples.zh: 还没开始就被夸奖让我有种“提前满足”的感觉，但也让我紧张。

examples.en: They planned a pregratifying surprise—small treats delivered before the big event.
examples.zh: 他们安排了一个“预先让人开心”的惊喜——在大活动前先送一些小点心。

definition.en: (Very rare) Relating to a feeling of pleasure that comes before the main reward or outcome.
definition.zh: （非常罕见）与“主要回报/结果到来之前的愉悦感”有关的。

examples.en: The pregratifying excitement of planning the trip was almost as good as the trip itself.
examples.zh: 计划旅行时那种“先快乐起来”的兴奋感几乎不亚于旅行本身。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代英语里几乎不作为规范词汇使用，很多情况下是临时造词（nonce word）或拼写/选词失误。更自然的表达通常是：gratifying（令人满足的）、satisfying（令人满意的）、rewarding（有回报感的）、or “gratifying in advance / beforehand”（提前就让人满足）。
词形上可以拆为 pre-（“在……之前”）+ gratifying（令人满足的）。因此读者通常能猜到大意，但在正式写作中不建议使用。

summary.en: “Pregreet” means to greet someone beforehand, before the main or official greeting.
summary.zh: “pregreet”指在主要或正式问候之前，先提前打招呼/致意。

definition.en: to greet someone in advance, especially before a formal meeting or official greeting happens
definition.zh: （在正式会面或正式问候之前）预先打招呼；提前致意

examples.en: I sent a quick message to pregreet the new team member before their first day.
examples.zh: 我发了条简短消息，提前跟新同事打个招呼，欢迎他第一天上班。

examples.en: The host pregreeted the guests at the entrance to make them feel comfortable.
examples.zh: 主持人在门口提前迎接客人，让他们感觉更放松。

extraExplanation: “pregreet”不是常见标准词，更像是口语/临时造词（pre- + greet）。在正式写作中更常用“greet in advance”“reach out beforehand”“welcome ahead of time”等表达。

summary.en: A rare term meaning a small action or moment that happens before the main greeting.
summary.zh: 一个较少见的说法，指正式问候之前的小动作或铺垫。

definition.en: (rare) Something said or done before the main greeting; a warm-up to saying hello.
definition.zh: （少见）在正式问候之前说或做的铺垫；“打招呼”前的暖场。

examples.en: Her quick smile was a pregreeting before she said, “Hi, everyone.”
examples.zh: 她先快速一笑，算是一个 pregreeting，然后才说：“大家好。”

examples.en: In some workplaces, small talk acts as a pregreeting to the real conversation.
examples.zh: 在一些职场里，闲聊常常充当正式交流前的 pregreeting。

definition.en: (rare, used before a noun) Happening or done before a greeting.
definition.zh: （少见，用作定语）在问候之前发生或进行的。

examples.en: They exchanged a pregreeting glance across the room.
examples.zh: 他们在房间里先交换了一个“问候前”的眼神。

examples.en: A pregreeting nod can make the greeting feel more natural.
examples.zh: 问候前点一下头，会让后面的打招呼更自然。

extraExplanation: “pregreeting”不是常见的标准词，更多是临时造词（creative coinage）。写作中更自然的表达包括："before greeting"、"pre-greeting"（加连字符更常见）、"a warm-up before saying hello"、"small talk before introductions"。
前缀“pre-”表示“在……之前”，常见于 pregame（赛前活动）、preseason（季前赛）、premeeting（会前）等。把它接到 greeting 上，含义通常也能被理解，但正式写作里建议换成更常用的说法。

summary.en: Pregrievance refers to the stage, steps, or meetings that happen before a formal grievance is filed, usually to solve a workplace problem informally.
summary.zh: pregrievance 指在正式提出申诉之前的阶段、步骤或会议，通常用于以非正式方式解决职场问题。

definition.en: (Workplace/labor relations) Happening before a formal grievance (a formal complaint) is filed; related to early, informal problem-solving.
definition.zh: （职场/劳资关系）发生在正式申诉（grievance，正式投诉）提出之前的；与前期、非正式解决问题相关。

examples.en: We held a pregrievance meeting to resolve the issue before it became formal.
examples.zh: 我们召开了申诉前会议，想在问题正式化之前解决它。

examples.en: The union and management use a pregrievance process to address small conflicts early.
examples.zh: 工会和管理层会用申诉前流程尽早处理小冲突。

definition.en: An informal step, discussion, or meeting that happens before filing a formal grievance.
definition.zh: 在提交正式申诉之前进行的非正式步骤、沟通或会议。

examples.en: Let’s try a pregrievance discussion before submitting paperwork.
examples.zh: 在递交材料前，我们先进行一次申诉前沟通吧。

examples.en: The policy encourages pregrievance talks between employees and supervisors.
examples.zh: 该政策鼓励员工与主管先进行申诉前沟通。

extraExplanation: “pregrievance”并不是非常常见的标准词，实际写作中更常见的形式是“pre-grievance”（带连字符）或“pregrievance meeting/process”。
它多出现在人力资源（HR）、工会与劳动合同语境中，强调“先非正式沟通、再进入正式申诉程序”，目的是节省时间、降低对立。
如果你在一般英语写作中使用，建议改用更通用的表达：“before filing a grievance / informal resolution stage / early dispute resolution”。

summary.en: “Pregrowth” means the time or condition before growth begins, used mostly in technical contexts (often written as “pre-growth”).
summary.zh: “pregrowth”指生长或增长开始之前的阶段或状态，多用于专业语境（常写作“pre-growth”）。

definition.en: (Often hyphenated: pre-growth) happening or existing before a period of growth; relating to the stage before growth begins.
definition.zh: （常写作 pre-growth）生长前的；增长发生之前的；与生长开始前阶段有关的。

examples.en: The researchers measured pregrowth hormone levels in the seedlings.
examples.zh: 研究人员测量了幼苗在生长前阶段的激素水平。

examples.en: The company focused on its pregrowth strategy before launching nationwide expansion.
examples.zh: 公司在全国扩张之前专注于其增长前策略。

definition.en: The stage or period before growth starts (used mainly in technical or specialized writing).
definition.zh: 生长开始之前的阶段或时期（多见于技术或专业写作）。

examples.en: During pregrowth, the cells prepare by building the proteins needed for division.
examples.zh: 在生长前期，细胞通过合成分裂所需的蛋白质来做准备。

examples.en: The model assumes a short pregrowth period followed by rapid expansion.
examples.zh: 该模型假设有一个短暂的增长前期，随后进入快速扩张。

extraExplanation: “pregrowth”在日常英语中不算常用，更常见的写法是加连字符的“pre-growth”，尤其在科研论文、商业报告里。
在生物学语境中，它常指生长开始前的准备阶段；在经济/商业语境中，常指“增长起飞前”的阶段（例如市场培育、产品打磨、团队搭建）。
写作提示：如果作定语修饰名词（如 pre-growth phase/period/strategy），用连字符通常更清晰。

summary.en: “Preguarantee” means to guarantee something in advance (or the advance guarantee itself).
summary.zh: “preguarantee”指“预先保证/预先担保”，也可指“事先给出的保证”。

definition.en: to guarantee (promise, insure, or secure) something in advance, before the main agreement or event happens
definition.zh: 预先担保；事先保证（在正式协议或事件发生前先作出保证或提供保障）

examples.en: The supplier preguaranteed delivery within seven days to win the contract.
examples.zh: 为了赢得合同，供应商预先保证七天内交货。

examples.en: Some lenders ask the borrower to preguarantee the loan with additional collateral.
examples.zh: 有些放贷机构会要求借款人用额外抵押物对贷款进行预先担保。

definition.en: an advance guarantee or promise made ahead of time
definition.zh: 预先担保；事先承诺（提前给出的保证）

examples.en: The deal included a preguarantee of a full refund if the product failed.
examples.zh: 该交易包含一项预先承诺：若产品故障将全额退款。

extraExplanation: “preguarantee”不是日常英语中的常用词，更常见的表达是“guarantee in advance / provide an advance guarantee / pre-approve / give assurances”。在法律、金融或合同语境里，为了强调“在事前就提供保证”，有时会看到这种带前缀 pre- 的构词。
构词提示：pre- 表示“在……之前”，guarantee 表示“保证/担保”。合在一起强调时间先后：保证发生在正式签约、交付或事件之前。

summary.en: “Preguaranteed” means “guaranteed in advance,” though it’s relatively uncommon and often written as “pre-guaranteed.”
summary.zh: “preguaranteed”表示“事先保证的/提前担保的”，但不算常用，常写作“pre-guaranteed”。

definition.en: guaranteed in advance; promised or assured before something happens (often used in marketing or contracts).
definition.zh: 事先保证的；提前承诺或确保的（常见于广告或合同语境）。

examples.en: The refund is preguaranteed if the product arrives damaged.
examples.zh: 如果商品到货时损坏，退款是事先保证的。

examples.en: They offered a preguaranteed rate for the first year of the loan.
examples.zh: 他们为贷款的第一年提供了事先保证的利率。

extraExplanation: “preguaranteed”在日常英语里不算常见，更常写作带连字符的“pre-guaranteed”。很多时候也会改用更自然的表达，比如“guaranteed in advance”“guaranteed beforehand”，或在金融/审核场景用“pre-approved（预先批准的）”。
构词上：前缀pre-表示“在……之前”，guaranteed表示“有保证的/被担保的”，合在一起强调“提前就保证好了”。

summary.en: “Preguaranteeing” means guaranteeing something ahead of time (often used in business or contracts).
summary.zh: “preguaranteeing”指“预先保证/事先担保”，常用于商务或合同语境。

definition.en: to guarantee something in advance (before it officially happens or before final conditions are known)
definition.zh: 预先保证；事先担保（在事情正式发生或最终条件明确之前先作保证）

examples.en: The company is not preguaranteeing delivery dates because weather can cause delays.
examples.zh: 公司不预先保证送达日期，因为天气可能导致延误。

examples.en: He avoided preguaranteeing results until the tests were finished.
examples.zh: 在测试完成前，他避免预先保证结果。

extraExplanation: “preguaranteeing”更常写作“pre-guaranteeing”（加连字符）或直接用更自然的表达，如“guarantee in advance / guarantee beforehand”。在正式写作中，英语更常用“make no guarantees”或“cannot guarantee X”来避免过度承诺。
这个词常见于商务、合同、客服语境，用来强调：还未满足条件，因此不会提前作出保证。

summary.en: “preguarantor” is not standard; it most likely means “guarantor,” a person who guarantees someone else’s debt or obligation.
summary.zh: “preguarantor”不是标准用词；多半指“guarantor（担保人）”，为他人的债务或义务提供担保的人。

definition.en: “preguarantor” is not a standard English word; it is usually a misspelling of “guarantor” (a person who promises to pay or perform if someone else fails to do so).
definition.zh: “preguarantor” 不是标准英语单词；通常是把 “guarantor”（担保人/保证人）拼错了，指在他人未履约或未付款时承担责任的人。

examples.en: The bank asked for a guarantor before approving the loan.
examples.zh: 银行在批准贷款前要求提供一位担保人。

examples.en: Her father agreed to act as the guarantor for the apartment lease.
examples.zh: 她父亲同意为这份公寓租约做担保人。

extraExplanation: 在金融、租房、留学申请等语境里，guarantor 很常见。它通常表示“第三方担保”：如果借款人/租客不还款或不支付费用，担保人需要承担付款责任。
有时你会看到 joint guarantor（共同担保人）或 personal guarantor（个人担保人）。而“pre-guarantor”并非常见固定用法；如果你是在表格或合同里看到 preguarantor，可能是拼写错误或某个机构的内部术语，建议核对原文或询问对方。

summary.en: “preguard” is a rare word meaning to guard or protect something beforehand.
summary.zh: “preguard”较少见，意思是“事先保护/预先设防”。

definition.en: (Rare/technical) To protect or guard something in advance; to put a safeguard in place beforehand.
definition.zh: （少见/偏技术）事先保护；预先设防；提前采取防护措施。

examples.en: The company preguarded its customer data with encryption before launching the app.
examples.zh: 公司在上线应用之前就用加密技术预先保护了客户数据。

examples.en: Hospitals often preguard critical systems to reduce the risk of outages.
examples.zh: 医院常常会提前为关键系统做好防护，以降低停机风险。

extraExplanation: “preguard”不是常见的标准英语单词，更常见的表达是：guard (protect) in advance、preemptively protect、take precautions、safeguard beforehand。
在技术语境里（如网络安全/系统工程），你也可能看到带连字符的写法“pre-guard”，用来强调“预先防护”的意思。

summary.en: “Preguess” means to guess in advance (or an early guess). It’s informal and uncommon; “predict” or “guess in advance” is more typical.
summary.zh: “preguess”指“预先猜测/提前预测”（或指“预先的猜测”）。它较口语且不常见，更常用“predict”或“guess in advance”。

definition.en: to guess (something) in advance, before having enough information; to make an early prediction
definition.zh: 预先猜测；在信息不足之前先做预测

examples.en: Before the quiz, I tried to preguess which chapters the teacher would focus on.
examples.zh: 测验前，我试着预先猜老师会重点考哪些章节。

examples.en: Don’t preguess the results—wait until all the data is in.
examples.zh: 别急着预先下结论——等数据都出来再说。

definition.en: an early guess or prediction made ahead of time
definition.zh: 预先的猜测；提前做出的预测

examples.en: Her preguess was close, but the final answer was different.
examples.zh: 她的预先猜测很接近，但最终答案不一样。

extraExplanation: “preguess”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的表达是“guess in advance / make an early guess / predict”。写作时也可能写成“pre-guess”（加连字符）来强调“pre-（事先）+ guess（猜）”的构词逻辑。
在正式写作（论文、新闻、商务报告）里，通常用“predict / estimate / forecast / anticipate”更自然、更正式。

summary.en: “Preguidance” (more commonly “pre-guidance”) means guidance given beforehand.
summary.zh: “preguidance”（更常见写法为“pre-guidance”）指在事情开始之前提供的预先指导。

definition.en: Guidance or advice given in advance (before an event, process, or decision).
definition.zh: 预先提供的指导或建议（在某个事件、流程或决定之前给出的指导）。

examples.en: The teacher gave pre-guidance on how to format the essay before students started writing.
examples.zh: 老师在学生开始写作前，先给了论文格式的预先指导。

examples.en: Pre-guidance helped the new employees avoid common mistakes during training.
examples.zh: 预先指导帮助新员工在培训中避免了常见错误。

extraExplanation: “preguidance”不是非常常见的标准单词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-guidance”，或直接说“guidance in advance / upfront guidance”。
在正式写作中，如果你想表达“提前给的说明/指导”，也可以用更自然的搭配：preliminary guidance（初步指导）、advance guidance（预先指导）、initial guidance（初始指导）。

summary.en: “preguide” means to give guidance in advance, or a guide provided beforehand; it’s uncommon and often written as “pre-guide.”
summary.zh: “preguide”指提前给予指导，或指预先提供的指南；不算常见，也常写作“pre-guide”。

definition.en: to guide or prepare someone in advance (before an activity, visit, lesson, etc.)
definition.zh: （在活动/参观/课程等之前）提前引导、预先指导

examples.en: Before the museum visit, the teacher preguided the class with a short video and key vocabulary.
examples.zh: 参观博物馆之前，老师用一段短视频和关键词汇先给全班做了预先指导。

examples.en: The coach preguided the new players on basic safety rules.
examples.zh: 教练在训练前先给新队员讲解了基本安全规则。

definition.en: a guide or set of instructions provided beforehand
definition.zh: 预先提供的指南；事前说明

examples.en: Please read the preguide before your first day at work.
examples.zh: 上班第一天前请先阅读这份预先指南。

examples.en: The event email included a preguide on what to bring.
examples.zh: 活动邮件里附了一个关于需要携带物品的预先指南。

extraExplanation: “preguide / pre-guide”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的表达是“prepare someone in advance / brief someone / give a pre-briefing / provide an orientation (guide)”。在培训、旅游、软件说明等语境里，有时会把它当作行业用语或临时造词来用。
写作时如果想更自然：动词可用“brief (someone)”或“walk (someone) through (something) ahead of time”；名词可用“pre-briefing / orientation guide / getting-started guide”。

summary.en: Preguided means guided in advance, with steps or choices already structured beforehand.
summary.zh: preguided 指“预先引导的”，即步骤或选择在开始前就被设定好。

definition.en: Guided or directed in advance; planned so that the steps or choices are already set for you before you begin.
definition.zh: 预先被引导的；在开始之前就被安排好步骤或选择、按既定路线进行的。

examples.en: The museum offered a preguided audio tour with numbered stops.
examples.zh: 博物馆提供了预先设计好的语音导览，按编号站点参观。

examples.en: This worksheet is preguided, so you just follow the prompts.
examples.zh: 这张练习单是预先引导式的，你只要按提示做就行。

extraExplanation: “preguided”不是非常常见的标准词，更常见的写法是带连字符的“pre-guided”，或用“guided in advance / preplanned / structured”来表达。
它常出现在教学、训练、导览、软件流程等语境，强调“提前设定路径/步骤”，与“self-guided（自助式）”相对。

summary.en: “Preguiding” means giving guidance in advance, often in education or training contexts.
summary.zh: “preguiding”指“事先/提前的指导或引导”，多用于教学、培训等语境。

definition.en: giving guidance or direction in advance (before an activity, decision, or event).
definition.zh: 提前给予指导或指引的（在活动、决定或事件发生之前）。

examples.en: The teacher sent a preguiding worksheet so students knew what to focus on during the museum visit.
examples.zh: 老师发了一份预习式的指导单，让学生在参观博物馆时知道该重点关注什么。

examples.en: A short preguiding conversation can help new employees feel less anxious on their first day.
examples.zh: 简短的入职前指导谈话能帮助新员工在第一天不那么紧张。

definition.en: the act of guiding in advance; providing preliminary guidance (often used in writing about teaching, training, or user experience).
definition.zh: 提前引导；预先提供指导（常见于教学、培训或用户体验等语境的写作中）。

examples.en: Preguiding is especially useful when learners are unfamiliar with the topic.
examples.zh: 当学习者对主题不熟悉时，预先引导尤其有用。

extraExplanation: “preguiding”不是最常见的日常词，更常见的表达包括：preliminary guidance（初步指导）、pre-guidance（预先指导）、advance guidance（事先指导）、orientation（入门介绍/岗前培训）。
构词法：pre-（在……之前）+ guiding（引导）。很多写作中会写成带连字符的 pre-guiding，以便更清晰。

summary.en: Preguilt means feeling guilty in advance, before something actually happens.
summary.zh: preguilt 指在事情发生之前就先产生的内疚感。

definition.en: guilt felt in advance—before something has happened (for example, before making a choice, breaking a rule, or waiting for the outcome).
definition.zh: 预先产生的内疚感——事情尚未发生前就先感到愧疚（例如在做决定、可能违规或等待结果之前）。

examples.en: Before I even told my parents the truth, I was already stuck in preguilt.
examples.zh: 我还没把真相告诉父母，就已经被“预先内疚”困住了。

examples.en: She felt preguilt about calling in sick, even though she was truly ill.
examples.zh: 尽管她真的生病了，但一想到请病假就先产生了预先内疚。

definition.en: (informal) showing or relating to guilt felt in advance.
definition.zh: （非正式）表现出或与预先内疚有关的。

examples.en: He gave me a preguilt look, like he expected trouble before anything happened.
examples.zh: 他给了我一种“预先内疚”的表情，好像事情还没发生就预感要惹麻烦。

extraExplanation: “preguilt”不是特别常见的标准词，更像是现代英语里用“pre-（预先）+ guilt（内疚）”造出来的口语/网络新词。它常用来描述一种焦虑式的自责：事情还没发生、也未必真的做错，但心里已经开始责备自己。
可以把它理解为和“pregrief（预先悲伤）”“premorse（预先懊悔，较少见）”同类的表达：用来强调情绪来得太早、太快。正式写作中更常用的说法包括“anticipatory guilt（预期性内疚）”或“guilt in advance（提前的内疚）”。

summary.en: Preguiltiness means feeling guilty before you’ve actually done anything wrong.
summary.zh: Preguiltiness 指在还没做错事之前就提前产生的内疚感。

definition.en: a feeling of guilt in advance, before you have actually done something wrong (often about a decision you are considering)
definition.zh: （在还没真的做错事之前）预先产生的内疚感；对可能的选择/决定感到提前自责

examples.en: Before I even said no, I felt preguiltiness about disappointing my parents.
examples.zh: 我甚至还没说“不”，就已经因为可能让父母失望而产生了预先的内疚感。

examples.en: She canceled the trip because of preguiltiness about leaving her team during a busy week.
examples.zh: 她因为担心在忙碌的一周里离开团队会过意不去（预先内疚），所以取消了旅行。

extraExplanation: “preguiltiness”不是常见的标准词汇，更像是临时造词（pre- + guiltiness），用来强调“事情还没发生就先内疚”。更自然、常见的表达包括：anticipatory guilt（预期性内疚）、preemptive guilt（先发制人的内疚/先行内疚）、feeling guilty ahead of time（提前感到内疚）。
语气上它带一点口语化、心理感受描述的味道，常见于自我反思、心理健康或社交关系的语境。

summary.en: “Preguilty” (often written “pre-guilty”) means assumed or treated as guilty before the facts are fully known.
summary.zh: “preguilty”（常写作“pre-guilty”）指在事实未充分查明前就预设或对待某人为有罪。

definition.en: judged or treated as guilty before evidence is properly examined; assumed guilty in advance
definition.zh: 在证据充分审查之前就被判定或对待为有罪的；预设有罪的

examples.en: Online rumors can make someone seem pre-guilty before any investigation is finished.
examples.zh: 网络谣言可能会让一个人在调查结束前就显得“预设有罪”。

examples.en: A fair trial requires that the defendant is not treated as pre-guilty.
examples.zh: 公正的审判要求被告不应被当作“预设有罪”。

extraExplanation: “preguilty / pre-guilty”不是非常标准、常见的词典词条，更常见的表达是“presumed guilty（被推定有罪）”或“prejudged（先入为主地判断）”。写作中更推荐用这些更通行的词。
在法律语境里，英语常强调“presumption of innocence（无罪推定）”，也就是与“pre-guilty（预设有罪）”相反的原则。

summary.en: “Pregust” is a rare verb meaning to taste something in advance, or figuratively to anticipate an experience.
summary.zh: “pregust”是一个很罕见的动词，表示“提前品尝”，也可比喻“预先感受/期待某种体验”。

definition.en: (rare) To taste something beforehand; to sample in advance.
definition.zh: （罕见）事先品尝；提前试吃。

examples.en: The chef let the team pregust the new sauce before service.
examples.zh: 主厨让团队在开餐前先试吃新酱汁。

examples.en: At the market, you can pregust a piece of cheese before buying.
examples.zh: 在集市上，你可以先尝一小块奶酪再决定买不买。

definition.en: (rare, figurative) To “taste” or sense something in advance; to anticipate an experience.
definition.zh: （罕见，比喻）预先感受；预先“尝到”某种体验；期待。

examples.en: Even before the trip, she could pregust the quiet of the mountains.
examples.zh: 旅行还没开始，她仿佛就已预先感受到群山的宁静。

examples.en: He pregusted victory and became careless.
examples.zh: 他过早地“尝到”胜利的滋味，于是变得大意。

extraExplanation: “pregust”在现代英语里非常少见，很多词典不会收录；更常见的表达是“taste in advance / sample / try (a bite) first”。
构词上可理解为pre-（在……之前）+ gust（品尝；同源于拉丁语gustare“品尝”）。英语里更常见的同源词包括“gustatory”（味觉的）。
如果你是在别处看到“pregust”，它可能是作者的造词（nonce word）或拼写变体；若你能提供上下文句子，我可以帮你判断更自然的替换说法。

summary.en: “Pregustant” is not standard English; it’s usually a misspelling of “pregnant.”
summary.zh: “pregustant”不是标准英语词，通常是“pregnant（怀孕的）”的拼写错误。

definition.en: (Not a standard English word.) Often a misspelling of “pregnant.”
definition.zh: （不是标准英语单词。）常见为“pregnant（怀孕的）”的拼写错误。

examples.en: I think you meant “pregnant,” not “pregustant.”
examples.zh: 我觉得你想写的是“pregnant”，不是“pregustant”。

definition.en: Pregnant: having a baby developing inside the body (expecting a baby).
definition.zh: pregnant：怀孕的；体内正在孕育婴儿的。

examples.en: She is three months pregnant.
examples.zh: 她怀孕三个月了。

examples.en: They announced that she’s pregnant.
examples.zh: 他们宣布她怀孕了。

definition.en: Pregnant (figurative): full of meaning, possibility, or future development.
definition.zh: pregnant（比喻）：意味深长的；充满可能性/将要发展的。

examples.en: There was a pregnant silence before he answered.
examples.zh: 他回答前有一阵意味深长的沉默。

examples.en: The moment felt pregnant with possibility.
examples.zh: 那一刻充满了可能性。

extraExplanation: “pregustant”在英语里不常见，也不被标准词典收录。网络上偶尔会把它当作“pregnant”的搞笑拼写（类似于故意拼错的梗），但正式写作与考试中应避免使用。
“pregnant”在口语里也常说：expecting（更委婉）、with child（较老式/文学）。

summary.en: Pregustation means a foretaste—tasting or experiencing something in advance, literally or figuratively.
summary.zh: pregustation 指“预尝/先尝”，也可比喻对将来事物的提前体验或预感。

definition.en: the act of tasting something beforehand; a foretaste or preview (often used figuratively for an early experience of something to come)
definition.zh: 预先品尝；先尝；（常比喻）对未来经历的预尝/预感

examples.en: The chef offered a small pregustation of the sauce before serving the full dish.
examples.zh: 主厨在上整道菜之前，让大家先尝了一小口酱汁。

examples.en: That first day in the new job was a pregustation of the busy weeks ahead.
examples.zh: 新工作第一天就是接下来忙碌数周的“预演/预尝”。

extraExplanation: 这个词比较少见、偏书面，常见替代表达有：foretaste（预尝/预感）、preview（预览）、sample（试吃/样品）、a taste of what’s to come（对未来的初体验）。
词源：来自拉丁语前缀 prae-（在……之前）+ gustare（品尝），字面意思就是“在之前品尝”。

summary.en: A rare, formal word meaning a person who tastes food or drink first, especially to check quality or safety.
summary.zh: 一个少见且偏正式的词，指先试吃食物或饮料的人，尤指为检查质量或安全。

definition.en: A person who tastes food or drink before others, especially to check its quality or safety (a taster).
definition.zh: 试吃者；（尤指为检查质量或安全而）先尝食物/饮料的人；侍尝官。

examples.en: In royal courts, a pregustator might taste the meal before it was served to the ruler.
examples.zh: 在王室宫廷里，侍尝官可能会在把餐点端给君主前先试吃。

examples.en: The chef asked a colleague to act as a pregustator and check the seasoning.
examples.zh: 主厨请一位同事先试吃，检查调味是否合适。

extraExplanation: “pregustator”比较少见、偏正式，多见于历史或文学语境。日常英语更常用 taster（试吃者）或 food taster（试毒/试吃者）。
词源上可理解为拉丁语 prae-（在前）+ gustare（品尝），字面意思是“在前面品尝的人”。
历史上“food taster”常与防毒有关（尤其在宫廷与权贵场合），但现代语境里更多是“先试吃、把关口味/品质”。

summary.en: A rare technical adjective meaning “before tasting; anticipatory of taste.”
summary.zh: 一个较罕见的专业形容词，意思是“品尝之前的；对味觉的预期的”。

definition.en: (Rare/technical) relating to what happens before tasting a food or drink; occurring in anticipation of taste.
definition.zh: （罕见/偏专业）指“尝到味道之前”的阶段；与对味觉的预期有关。

examples.en: The study measured pregustic reactions, like salivation, before participants took a bite.
examples.zh: 这项研究测量了参与者咬下去之前的“尝前反应”，比如分泌唾液。

examples.en: A sweet smell can trigger pregustic expectations of flavor.
examples.zh: 甜香气味会引发对味道的“尝前预期”。

extraExplanation: “pregustic”不是常见词，在一般英语词典里往往查不到，更多见于学术/技术写作。日常表达通常用更常见的词：pregustatory（尝前的）、anticipatory（预期的）。
词源上可理解为 pre-（在……之前）+ gust-（味觉/品尝，见于 gustatory “味觉的”）。
